0.title: Tata Power hit by cyberattack, says 'all critical operational systems functioning'
0.article_body: Tata Power has confirmed that it was hit by a cyberattack that impacted some of its IT systems. "[We have] taken steps to retrieve and restore the systems. All critical operational systems are functioning," the power generation company wrote in a statement to stock exchanges. Tata Power has restricted access for employee and customer facing portals as a precautionary measure.

1.title: Rickshaw driver killed, 2 others injured in multi-vehicle crash in Delhi
1.article_body: A 40-year-old rickshaw driver died and two others were injured after an RTV (Rural Transport Vehicle) bus, a rickshaw, an auto-rickshaw and a motorcycle crashed near Kalkaji Depot in Delhi's Okhla, police said. The RTV driver lost balance and hit other vehicles, police added. The 26-year-old driver was apprehended on the spot, police further said.

2.title: He was one of the funniest people I've met: Daniel Radcliffe on Robbie Coltrane's demise
2.article_body: Daniel Radcliffe, who portrayed the titular role in the 'Harry Potter' films, mourned the demise of Robbie Coltrane, who portrayed Hagrid. "Robbie was one of the funniest people I've met and used to keep us laughing constantly as kids on the set," Radcliffe said. "He was an incredible actor and a lovely man," he added.

3.title: Bangladesh make 2 last-minute changes to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad
3.article_body: Bangladesh have made two last-minute changes to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad after the tri-series in New Zealand. Soumya Sarkar and Shoriful Islam have been included in the final 15-member group. The duo replace Sabbir Rahman and Mohammad Saifuddin in the squad. Both Shoriful and Sarkar were initially named in the reserves for the tournament.

4.title: India briefs G-20 countries on its agenda ahead of presidency
4.article_body: India has briefed the member nations of the G20 on the agenda that New Delhi will be pursuing when it assumes the grouping's rotating presidency next year. Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and Reserve Bank of India Governor Shaktikanta Das elaborated on India's agenda during a G20 leaders meeting in Washington on Thursday. Details of the agenda were not disclosed.

5.title: Russian man detained in Norway admits to illegally flying drones
5.article_body: A 50-year-old Russian man, who was detained in Arctic Norway earlier in the week, has admitted to illegally flying two drones in Norwegian airspace over areas potentially with critical energy infrastructure. The man was produced in a Norwegian court on Friday and was sent to two weeks in custody. Three passports (two Russian and one Israeli) were recovered from him.

6.title: Should create a gas exchange market in Turkey: Putin to Erdogan
6.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has proposed that a natural gas exchange market be set up in Turkey. "We could consider building another gas pipeline...in Turkey for sale to third countries, especially in Europe," he said, adding that the hub "will be an international distribution centre". He made the comments during a meeting with his Turkish counterpart Recep Erdogan.

7.title: Pakistan make 1 change to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad, replace Qadir with Fakhar
7.article_body: Pakistan have made a change to their T20 World Cup 2022 squad, with standby batter Fakhar Zaman being promoted to the 15-player main squad. He has replaced leg-spinner Usman Qadir. Qadir hasn't played for Pakistan since he hurt his thumb while fielding during the fourth T20I against England last month and he is yet to recover.

8.title: Files of 27 yrs of corruption burnt in Guj: Cong on Old Secretariat fire
8.article_body: The Congress has alleged that the fire that broke out at Gujarat's Old Secretariat on Friday was an attempt by the BJP to burn government files to hide corruption ahead of the state Assembly elections. "The BJP is aware of going out of power...In this panic, the files of 27 years of corruption are being burnt," the party added.

9.title: TMC's Sudip Bandyopadhyay compromised with BJP: TMC MLA
9.article_body: TMC MLA Tapas Roy on Friday accused TMC MP Sudip Bandyopadhyay of "compromising" with "opposition BJP". Calling Bandyopadhyay a "white elephant", the senior TMC leader added, "What has been his role in the Parliament, apart from praising Prime Minister Narendra Modi's dress?" Notably, Roy has been criticising Bandyopadhyay for the past few days for allegedly promoting BJP leader Tamoghna Ghosh.

10.title: Thank you all: World no. 2 Nadal on wishes after the birth of his child
10.article_body: World number two Rafael Nadal took to Twitter on Thursday after the birth of his baby boy last week and wrote, "Hello everyone. After a few days and many loving messages I just wanted to thank you all!" "We are very happy and everyone is very well! A big hug," he added. Nadal last played in Laver Cup in September.

11.title: He hasn't played 1 T20I since last WC: Aakash on Shami's inclusion in India's squad
11.article_body: Sharing his views on Mohammad Shami replacing Jasprit Bumrah in India's T20I World Cup 2022 squad, Aakash Chopra said, "Shami to replace Bumrah. Makes perfect sense." He added, "What doesn't make sense is the fact that he hasn't played a single T20I since the last World Cup. And that's got nothing to do with his fitness. He was always available."

12.title: I would go with Arshdeep, Shami, Bhuvi in playing XI for T20 WC: Uthappa
12.article_body: Ex-cricketer Robin Uthappa said that he would want India to play with three pure pacers namely Arshdeep Singh, Mohammad Shami and Bhuvneshwar Kumar in the playing XI for the T20 World Cup games. "I would ideally want to go with a left-arm fast bowler because that change of angle makes a huge difference...[and] also you have Hardik Pandya," Uthappa said.

13.title: Reece James, 2018 winner Kante doubtful for 2022 WC due to injury
13.article_body: Chelsea manager Graham Potter said England defender Reece James and French midfielder N'Golo Kante will see specialists for their injuries in the coming days. James and Kante's diagnoses will determine their chances of playing in the Qatar World Cup.  Potter also confirmed that France defender Wesley Fofana is unlikely to play in the World Cup due to a knee injury.

14.title: Urvashi Rautela accused of copying her TEDx Talks speech, social media users react
14.article_body: Urvashi Rautela made an appearance at a recent TEDx Talks event and people have claimed that she copied her speech from previous speakers. She also appears to have googled listicles about the most popular ones, and lifted points from there, people claimed. "Can we...cancel her already!" a person reacted while another comment read, "I need this kind of confidence."

15.title: After 0-8 defeat against USA, India lose 0-3 to Morocco in FIFA U-17 Women's World Cup
15.article_body: After losing their first match 0-8 against USA, India suffered a 0-3 defeat against Morocco in the FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup in Bhubaneswar. All three of Morocco's goals came in the second half. India will not be able to advance to the knockout stage. Their last group match against Brazil will take place on October 17.

16.title: People's unity is crucial for building India: NC's Farooq Abdullah
16.article_body: National Conference (NC) President Farooq Abdullah said people's unity is crucial for building India and asked them to stand up against the "divisive forces" trying to weaken the country. "Our country is diverse, there's diversity of faiths, cultures and climates. What unites us is our faith," Abdullah said. "From Kashmir to Kanniyakumari, we have to unite this country," he added.

17.title: Robbie Coltrane, who played Hagrid in 'Harry Potter' films, passes away aged 72
17.article_body: Actor Robbie Coltrane, who played Rubeus Hagrid in 'Harry Potter' films, has passed away aged 72. He was also known for starring in British TV series 'Cracker', for which he won three consecutive Best Actor BAFTA TV awards. In a statement, his agent Belinda Wright described Coltrane as a "unique talent". He also featured in two 'James Bond' films.

18.title: Indian American student's roommate charged with murder for stabbing him to death
18.article_body: Korean student Ji Min Sha, accused of stabbing his Indian-origin roommate to death in their dormitory at US' Purdue University, has been charged with murder. Prosecutors said that Sha "knowingly or intentionally" killed 20-year-old Varun Manish Chheda. Sha (22) stabbed Chheda multiple times in the head and neck before calling the authorities to report the death.

19.title: Rudrankksh Patil wins 10m Air Rifle gold at ISSF World Championship
19.article_body: Rudrankksh Patil won gold in the men's 10m air rifle event in the ISSF World Championship in Cairo, becoming the second Indian to achieve the feat after Abhinav Bindra. The 18-year-old also secured India's second 2024 Paris Olympics quota in the process. Rudrankksh beat Italy's Danilo Dennis Sollazzo 17-13 in the gold medal match after a come-from-behind effort.

20.title: Guj poll dates not announced to give PM time to make inaugurations: Cong
20.article_body: The Congress on Friday said the Election Commission deferred announcing the election dates for Gujarat to give PM Narendra Modi more time to make "mega promises and inaugurations". "Not at all surprising," Congress leader Jairam Ramesh tweeted. His comment comes as the EC did not announce the schedule for Gujarat Assembly elections along with the dates for Himachal Pradesh elections.

21.title: Was heartbroken after being rejected for 'Bajirao...': '83' actor Addinath
21.article_body: Actor Addinath Kothare, who made his Bollywood debut in '83', revealed that he auditioned for Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Bajirao Mastani' but the role went to his actor-friend Vaibhav Tatwawadi instead, who essayed Chimaji Appa in the film. "I was heartbroken. It was indeed a bummer. It's the only film from my entire career that...I wish I had got," Addinath added.

22.title: John is a gentleman, was a pleasure to work with him: Manushi on 'Tehran'
22.article_body: Actress Manushi Chhillar, speaking about her upcoming film 'Tehran', said that she was happy that she had a co-actor like John Abraham. "He's a thorough professional and a gentleman and it was a pleasure to work and learn from him," she added. Manushi further said shooting for 'Tehran' was an enriching experience, adding that she learnt something new every day.

23.title: Harjot Singh Bains appointed as AAP in-charge in poll-bound Himachal
23.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Friday appointed Punjab School Education Minister Harjot Singh Bains as the party in-charge in poll-bound Himachal Pradesh. This comes after the Election Commission of India announced that the state Assembly elections will be held on November 12. The Twitter handle of AAP wrote, "Himachal will vote for change! Himachal will vote for Kejriwal!"

24.title: No need for more massive strikes on Ukraine, most designated targets hit: Putin
24.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Friday said there was "no need for massive strikes" on Ukraine anymore as most designated targets had been hit, after a barrage of missile strikes earlier this week killed at least 19. "We do not set ourselves the task of destroying Ukraine. No, of course not," said Putin during a news conference.

25.title: Wanted to bat like Sachin, realised I can't play like him: MS Dhoni
25.article_body: Former India captain MS Dhoni, at a recent event, said that his cricketing role model has always been Sachin Tendulkar. "I used to watch Sachin play and wanted to bat like him. Later on, I realised I can’t play like him but inside my heart, I always wanted to play like him," he said.

26.title: 4 killed as BMW car gets completely destroyed after collision with truck in UP; pics surface
26.article_body: As many as four persons were killed on Purvanchal Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur when a container truck hit their BMW car today. The collision was so severe that the engine of the car and all four occupants were blown away and fell at some distance away, an official said. The container truck was reportedly coming from the opposite direction.

27.title: Anil Deshmukh admitted to Mumbai hospital for angiography
27.article_body: Former Maharashtra Home Minister Anil Deshmukh, who is lodged in Arthur Road jail in Mumbai, was admitted to Jaslok Hospital on Friday to undergo coronary angiography. The Nationalist Congress Party leader was admitted to the same hospital earlier this year after he dislocated his shoulder. Deshmukh was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate in November 2021 on money laundering charges.

28.title: Liverpool, not Arsenal, biggest PL title challengers: Man City coach
28.article_body: Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola said Liverpool are the defending champions' "biggest challengers" for the Premier League title. Liverpool currently sit 10th in the table, 13 points behind City who are trailing table toppers Arsenal by one point. "I know the quality they have...with so long (in the season) left plus a World Cup, anything can happen," said Guardiola.

29.title: Haaland is a perfect fit at Manchester City: Liverpool manager Klopp
29.article_body: Praising Erling Haaland, Liverpool manager Jürgen Klopp said the Manchester City striker's "finishing skills are exceptional but he moves really smart". He added, "So many things to make a striker, and at City he has some of the best players around him setting up goals. It's a perfect fit." Liverpool will face Manchester City in Premier League on Sunday.

30.title: Decomposed body of 23-yr-old IIT Kharagpur student found in hostel room
30.article_body: The semi-decomposed body of a 23-year-old student was found in the hostel room of IIT Kharagpur, with the police suspecting suicide. The student, identified as Faizan Ahmed, was a third-year mechanical engineering student and a resident of Assam's Tinsukia. A 20-year-old student was found hanging in his hostel room at IIT Guwahati, earlier this month.

31.title: Filmmaker Vishal Bhardwaj buys new luxury apartment for ₹19.5 cr in Mumbai
31.article_body: Vishal Bhardwaj has reportedly purchased a new luxury apartment in Mumbai's Versova. The apartment, which costs ₹19.5 crore, is located on 21st floor of the Bay View residential tower and spreads across 2,056 sq ft. Vishal has purchased the apartment with his wife and singer Rekha Bhardwaj and son Aasmaan. They'll also get three car parking slots in the tower.

32.title: Spain refuses to send riot police to help Qatar during FIFA WC
32.article_body: Spain said it will not be sending riot police to Qatar to help safeguard the FIFA World Cup as had been requested by the Middle Eastern country. Spain had reportedly been considering sending 115 officers to Qatar, which is facing a shortage of personnel. Last month, Turkey announced it would send more than 3,000 riot police to help Qatar.

33.title: Pakistan are a dangerous team: India batter Mukund ahead of T20 WC
33.article_body: India batter Abhinav Mukund said that Pakistan are a "dangerous" side ahead of upcoming T20 World Cup. He added that Pakistan's "old school" cricket has failed them many times but worked against New Zealand in tri-series final and with their "spectacular" bowling line-up, the plan might work in Australia. "Don't see many teams hitting 200 against them," he further said.

34.title: This is the beginning of something big: Bhogle on women's IPL in March 2023
34.article_body: After BCCI announced that the women's IPL will take place with five teams in March 2023, Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Delighted to see that...WIPL is on its way." He added, "Was hoping they could've managed six teams, if not eight, with existing franchises setting up women's arm. Maybe in...future, but this is the beginning of something big...we must all support it."

35.title: Coast Guard ship frees 6 Indian fishermen from Pakistani captivity
35.article_body: An Indian Coast Guard ship managed to free Indian fishermen who were being taken to a Pakistani port by Pakistan Maritime Security Agency. The fishermen's boat, which was involved in fishing activities off the Gujarat coast, sank after it was fired on twice. One fisherman was left in an unconscious state in the water and six others were held captive.

36.title: Martin Scorsese to direct 'Gangs of New York' TV series
36.article_body: Academy Award-winning filmmaker Martin Scorsese is turning his feature 'Gangs of New York' into a TV series. He will serve as an executive producer on the project and also direct the first two episodes. The film, which was released in 2002, starred Leonardo DiCaprio, Cameron Diaz, Liam Neeson and Brendan Gleeson, among others, in key roles.

37.title: Centre approves ₹1,000 cr suspension bridge across Krishna river
37.article_body: The Centre has approved the construction of a cable-stayed-cum-suspension bridge across the Krishna river which will connect Telangana and Andhra Pradesh and pass through the Nallamala forest. Union Minister of Road Transport and Highways Nitin Gadkari said the bridge will be constructed in 30 months and cost ₹1,082.56 crore. He said the bridge will have a glass pedestrian walkway.

38.title: Punjab, Haryana CMs fail to reach a consensus on water sharing
38.article_body: The two-hour-long talks between Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Friday failed to reach a consensus on the sharing of water through the Sutlej Yamuna Link canal. Mann said the canal's construction is not required as Punjab has no excess water. "We cannot call Sutlej and Beas rivers. Now, they are just drains," he said.

39.title: Large, mysterious creature washes ashore in US' Oregon; pic goes viral
39.article_body: A couple from Oregon, US discovered a mysterious blob-like creature on the coast near Florence on October 12. They believe it's what's known as a "globster", a decomposing whale or shark that looks like it's covered in white hair. The creature was the size of a pickup truck and reeked of decomposing mammal.

40.title: Dolphins spotted at Injambakkam in Chennai; video surfaces
40.article_body: A video showing dolphins spotted at Injambakkam beach in Chennai has gone viral on social media. A journalist shared the video on Twitter. While a user said it is a common occurrence, others said they were glad that event was recorded and shared as dolphins don't usually appear near the same spot. Another user wrote, "Lovely," reacting to the video.

41.title: Ready and fully confident for Himachal polls: AAP's Durgesh Pathak
41.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) said it is "ready" for the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections and "fully confident" of getting the people's mandate. Party leader Durgesh Pathak said teams formed by the party in every village of Himachal Pradesh are "working hard" to reach out to the masses. He added that Congress and the BJP had "looted" the state.

42.title: Centre sends 6-member team to manage dengue in 3 UP districts
42.article_body: The central government has deputised a high-level multi-disciplinary team to Uttar Pradesh to manage the spread of dengue in Firozabad, Agra and Etawah districts. The six-member central team will be headed by Dr VK Chaudhary of the Regional Office of Health and Family Welfare, Lucknow. The team shall work with the state health departments and recommend necessary public health interventions.

43.title: Govt launches welfare fund donation website for martyrs' families
43.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh launched 'Maa Bharati Ke Sapoot' website on Friday that will enable Indian citizens to financially contribute to the Armed Forces Battle Casualties Welfare Fund (AFBCWF). Amitabh Bachchan is the 'Goodwill Ambassador' of the portal. The website was launched at an event at National War Memorial complex. AFBCWF provides financial aid to families of battle casualties.

44.title: Arjun Tendulkar records his career-best T20 bowling figures
44.article_body: Fast bowler Arjun Tendulkar on Friday recorded his career-best bowling figures in T20 cricket. Arjun, playing his third match for Goa, recorded bowling figures of 4-1-10-4 against Hyderabad in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. He bowled 17 dot balls and conceded just one boundary. The 23-year-old has taken six wickets in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy this season.

45.title: Woman molested by auto driver, dragged with vehicle in Maha; incident caught on camera
45.article_body: CCTV footage of a molestation incident in Maharashtra's Thane showed an auto driver dragging the alleged victim with his vehicle for half a kilometre. The auto driver allegedly passed a comment on the student and when she questioned him, caught hold of her hand and pulled her, police said. He raced the auto while she held onto him, police added.

46.title: Film on RSS founder KB Hedgewar in the works
46.article_body: A biopic on RSS founder KB Hedgewar is in early works. It will be made in Hindi, Marathi and English. Jayanand Shetty, producer of the film, said that the upcoming movie is a "tribute to his journey, his struggles and his movements". "Even today, Dr Hedgewar is a much revered figure in the Nationalist Movement of India," Jayanand added.

47.title: Maha lawyer sentenced to 6 months in jail for using casteist slurs
47.article_body: A court in Maharashtra's Thane sentenced a 44-year-old lawyer to six months of imprisonment for using casteist slurs against a man during an argument. The complainant had lent the lawyer ₹1 lakh, but the latter refused to return the amount and used casteist slurs. The court said a "lenient view" of such cases could lead to an "unstable social atmosphere".

48.title: Rash drivers in Kerala will have to do mandatory community service
48.article_body: The Kerala Government has reportedly decided to impose mandatory community service on drivers involved in major accidents and found driving under influence. The drivers will have to undergo a three-day service at trauma or palliative care centres. The driver will also have their licence suspended and be asked to attend a three-day training at the driving institute in Malappuram district.

49.title: Johnny Depp's pics in clean-shaven look go viral; fans say he looks unrecognisable
49.article_body: Johnny Depp debuted a new look as he kick-started a tour with his friend Jeff Beck in New York City. Several fans said he looked unrecognisable as he shaved his moustache and goatee and was seen in a clean-shaven look. "I'm not used to his shaven look," a fan reacted while another joked, "That's not Johnny Depp. End of story."

50.title: NIA raids multiple locations in J&K over drone delivery case
50.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) reportedly conducted searches at multiple locations in Jammu and Kashmir as part of its investigation into the Pakistan drone delivery case. The case pertains to over two dozen sightings of Pakistani drones dropping weapons and explosives in the valley. A man has reportedly been brought in for questioning by the agency.

51.title: Congress needs to work a lot to form regional alliances: Tharoor
51.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor said the party has to "work a lot" to form alliances with regional parties ahead of the 2024 general elections. He added that "it is very necessary" that Congress stops leaders from leaving the party. He also said Congress is the only party that can put up a good fight against the BJP.

52.title: New Ugandan law criminalises certain online activities
52.article_body: Ugandan President Yoweri Museveni on Thursday passed a law that criminalises certain internet activities such as spreading "hateful and unwarranted information". The new law proposes prison sentences of up to 10 years in certain cases where users are found transmitting information about a person without their consent. The related bill was passed by the country's legislature in September this year.

53.title: 8 colonial-era mummies unearthed in Peru
53.article_body: Archaeologists have unearthed eight centuries-old mummies in Peru. The ancient preserved corpses also included the remains of children. "This finding backs our hypothesis that this could be [a] cemetery from the colonial period," a researcher said. The mummies were found in unusual positions and with a mix of textiles that pointed to the influence of Spanish colonials, an official said.

54.title: SC refuses urgent hearing of plea on firecrackers' ban
54.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday refused to urgently hear a plea related to the ban on firecrackers announced by various state governments. "People must have invested money...you should have come...earlier," the SC said, adding that Diwali was around the corner. Earlier, the court had refused to stay the Delhi government's order which banned firecrackers till January 1.

55.title: Middle order was outstanding: Babar on Pak's win vs NZ in tri-series final
55.article_body: After Pakistan defeated New Zealand by five wickets in the tri-series final, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said his side deserves all the credit for the way they played. "The bowlers were brilliant at the death. The way the middle order played was outstanding. Haider Ali and Muhammad Nawaz are outstanding," he added. All-rounder Nawaz was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

56.title: Ban on animal slaughter, transport to fight lumpy skin disease: K'taka Minister
56.article_body: Karnataka Minister of Animal Husbandry Prabhu B Chavan on Thursday assured cattle owners that the government is banning animal slaughter and transport to combat lumpy skin disease. Respective district administrations have been instructed to ban cattle fairs, markets and transportation to prevent the further spread of the disease, he said, adding live vaccine is being given as preventive medicine.

57.title: Bira 91 acquires retail bar chain The Beer Cafe in all-stock deal
57.article_body: Premium beer manufacturing company Bira 91 has acquired India's largest alcobev retail chain The Beer Cafe in an all-stock deal. The bar and restaurant chain will become a fully owned subsidiary of Bira 91. "The deal will enable Bira 91 to strengthen its play in pubs and build a direct-to-consumer platform focused on beer," Bira 91 CEO Ankur Jain said.

58.title: India's Esow finishes 12th in keirin final at Cycling Track World C'ships
58.article_body: Indian cyclist Esow Alban finished 12th in the 7th-12th place men's keirin ranking final at ongoing Cycling Track World Championships 2022 in France on Thursday. The 21-year-old made history when he became the first-ever Indian to qualify for the semi-final of the tournament earlier in the day. Notably, this is Alban's maiden senior World Championships.

59.title: Fire breaks out at Gujarat's Old Secretariat; files & furniture burnt
59.article_body: One of the floors of Gujarat's Old Secretariat building reported a fire on Friday. Gandhinagar's chief fire officer said the fire broke out at the Gram Vikas office due to a suspected electrical fault. Files and furniture of the rural department were reportedly burnt. No casualties were reported. A video from the scene showed smoke emanating from the building.

60.title: 35-yr-old man held for rape, murder of minor girl in UP's Mathura
60.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested on Friday for allegedly raping and killing a 10-year-old girl in Uttar Pradesh's Mathura, police said. The naked body of the girl was found in a forest area on Thursday and the family members had alleged rape before murder, police added. During interrogation, the man confessed to killing the girl after raping her, SSP said.

61.title: What is India's schedule at T20 World Cup 2022?
61.article_body: India will begin their T20 World Cup 2022 campaign with Super 12 stage Group 2 match against Pakistan on October 23. India will then face Group A runners-up of first round on October 27, and South Africa and Bangladesh on October 30 and November 2, respectively. India will then face Group B winners of first round on November 6.

62.title: Crew told us to pray, it was embarrassing: Passenger of smoke-filled SpiceJet flight
62.article_body: One of the passengers of the Goa-Hyderabad SpiceJet flight that detected smoke mid-air on Wednesday, said, "The crew members told us to pray to God...It was mortifying." The airline has, however, denied the claim, calling it "unfounded". Another passenger reportedly said the crew told passengers to "jump and run" as soon as the emergency doors opened.

63.title: BJP brought development, other parties unleashed violence: Tripura CM
63.article_body: Tripura CM Manik Saha said the BJP-led government in Tripura has ushered in many development initiatives since 2018 and all other parties have a long history of political violence. "The only option for people is...BJP, guided by leaders like Narendra Modi, Amit Shah and JP Nadda," he added. He urged people to vote for the BJP in upcoming Assembly elections.

64.title: 4 PFI offices sealed in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore
64.article_body:
The district administration on Friday sealed four offices of banned Popular Front of India (PFI) in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore. A team led by the South Tehsildar reportedly sealed the two PFI offices at Kottaimedu and Vincent Road. PFI offices at Mettupalayam and Pollachi were also sealed.
Police were deployed at the above places and also in sensitive areas, officials said.

65.title: ESA spacecraft takes fiery visuals of Sun before close fly-by
65.article_body: ESA's Solar Orbiter took a sequence of images that show the sun blazing with solar explosions before making its last close approach to the Sun on Friday. The colours in the images were, however, added artificially because the original wavelength of the light emitted by the gas in the Sun's atmosphere is invisible to the human eye.

66.title: Rahul Gandhi can never be on par with PM Modi: Union Minister
66.article_body: Union Minister of State for Agriculture and Farmers Welfare Shobha Karandlaje said Congress MP Rahul Gandhi can never attain the stature of PM Narendra Modi. "Rahul shows only his physical fitness. Can he lead the country?" Shobha asked. She added that the people of India will decide whether Rahul has the mental fitness to rule the country.

67.title: Man fined ₹20,000 over SC plea to declare Satyendar Jain 'of unsound mind'
67.article_body: The Supreme Court on Friday, reacting to a plea seeking to declare Delhi minister Satyendar Jain as a "person with unsound mind" and disqualify him from the Assembly on this ground, called it "ridiculous". Jain is in judicial custody in a money laundering case since May 30. The petition deserves to be dismissed with a cost of ₹20,000, SC added.

68.title: We can't cry over it for next 3 years: Director Puri on Liger's failure
68.article_body: Director Puri Jagannadh, speaking about the failure of his film 'Liger', said, "We can't cry over it for next three years." "If I look back, the days I was happier are more than the days I was sad," he added. Starring Vijay Deverakonda and Ananya Panday in the lead roles, the action film reportedly collected around ₹20 crore in India.

69.title: India need to pick up their fielding ahead of T20 WC: Ravi Shastri
69.article_body: Ahead of the T20 World Cup, ex-coach Ravi Shastri said that India need to pick up their fielding and have to start right from the beginning in that aspect of the game. "Those 15-20 runs you save will make all the difference...This is where other sides [like] Australia, England and New Zealand [are ahead]...They field like crazy," Shastri said.

70.title: 5 injured as vehicles in UP Dy CM's convoy collide with each other
70.article_body: Three police personnel, a doctor and a health worker were injured after two vehicles, including an ambulance, collided with each other in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur on Friday. The vehicles were part of Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak's convoy. BJP MLA Shashank Trivedi and Sitapur CMO Dr Madhu Gairola visited the district hospital, where the injured persons are admitted.

71.title: Vicky Kaushal and Aanand L Rai team up for a love story: Report
71.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal and filmmaker Aanand L Rai are reportedly teaming up for a love story. The film will go on floors in 2023. "The hunt for the female lead is underway. Like all his (Aanand) previous films, this one too has a strong character full of substance for the female counterpart," a source was quoted as saying.

72.title: Farmer murdered with spade over argument in UP's Fatehpur
72.article_body: A farmer was murdered in Senpur village in UP's Fatehpur district. The deceased, Ramasray Yadav (50), was working in his field where he had an argument with four other villagers before they attacked him with a spade, police said. Notably, Yadav was declared dead at a hospital. Police have registered a case and have formed teams to arrest the accused.

73.title: You're polluting minds of young generation: SC to Ekta Kapoor on 'XXX' web series
73.article_body: Supreme Court has criticised producer Ekta Kapoor over "objectionable content" in her web series 'XXX' saying she was polluting minds of young generation. It was hearing a plea challenging arrest warrants issued against her for allegedly insulting soldiers in the web series. "OTT...content is available to all. What kind of choice are you providing to the people?" the court said.

74.title: Ricky Kej tweets clip of cockroach in flight, IndiGo says, 'insects find a way at times'
74.article_body: Grammy-winning Indian-origin composer Ricky Kej on Friday shared a video of a cockroach crawling inside a Patna to Delhi IndiGo flight and said, "I am sure it got a complimentary meal." Replying to him, IndiGo said, "While stringent cleaning and fumigation is done before every flight, at times, these insects find a way inside...our crew...[are] always there to help."

75.title: Kohli talks to Pandya for 20 minutes after India's defeat in warm-up match, video viral
75.article_body: A video has gone viral showing former Team India captain Virat Kohli talking to all-rounder Hardik Pandya for 20 minutes on the ground after India's defeat in their warm-up match against Western Australia. In the video shared by journalist Vimal Kumar, Kohli can apparently be seen giving batting tips to Pandya. Notably, Kohli did not feature in the warm-up match.

76.title: 20-yr-old man arrested for hoax call of terror attack on Gorakhnath Temple
76.article_body: A 20-year-old man was reportedly arrested for making a hoax call of a terror attack on Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhnath Temple. He called emergency number 112, identified himself as senior police officer Pradyumna and gave information about terrorists planning to blow up the temple on Diwali. When police reached his home and found he had given false information, they arrested him.

77.title: India can definitely finish on podium at hockey WC 2023: Baskaran
77.article_body: Ex-Indian men's hockey team captain and coach Vasudevan Baskaran said he believes that India can definitely finish on the podium at hockey World Cup 2023 in Odisha. "They should move on from the CWG final loss to Australia and ride on the confidence they gained from the Tokyo Olympic Games," he added. India finished sixth at World Cup in 2018.

78.title: AAP councillor's car among 24 vehicles vandalised in Chandigarh
78.article_body: Over two dozen four-wheeler vehicles, including a car belonging to AAP councillor Suman Devi, were vandalised by unknown persons in Chandigarh's Subhash Nagar between 2 am and 3.30 am on Friday. According to local residents, front and rear mirrors, windowpanes and roofs were damaged in the incident. "It could be an act of jealousy or revenge," SHO Rohtash Yadav said.

79.title: 30 Nepali principals, teachers visit government schools in Delhi
79.article_body: A Nepali delegation of 30 school principals, vice principals and educators is visiting government schools in Delhi to learn "best practices", said the Directorate of Education. The delegation noted several school programmes such as 'Deshbhakti' and International Baccalaureate. A delegation member said they want to "understand the ground-level implementation process of unique curricula".

80.title: Committee formed to study gaps in Gurugram's drainage system
80.article_body: Commissioner of Gurugram division Ramesh Chander Bidhan has formed a panel to study shortcomings in the city's drainage system and suggest remedial measures. The decision comes after the city reported heavy waterlogging twice in the last two months. As per plans, the committee will examine rainfall data, the city's topography and the lateral stormwater drainage capacity.

81.title: Bengaluru civic body sets Oct 31 deadline to complete key ongoing projects
81.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike has set October 31 as the deadline to complete work on some key ongoing projects in the city. The decision came after BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath reviewed the works of the BBMP project division. The projects include Shivananda Circle to Race Course Junction Flyover and the Intermediate Ring Road from Domlur flyover to Ejipura.

82.title: SC scolds lawyer appearing virtually, says 'we're here 10am-5pm, you come for 5 mins'
82.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Friday took strong exception to a senior lawyer appearing before it virtually and refused to proceed with the matter, asking him to be physically present in court. "We're sitting in court from 10 am to 5 pm. This is unacceptable...You people just come on screen for five minutes and go back somewhere," said SC.

83.title: Hospital staff, neighbours attack each other over parking issue in Hyd
83.article_body: A doctor and employees of a private hospital and its neighbours attacked each other on Thursday over a parking dispute at Lal Darwaza, Hyderabad. The neighbours had reportedly obstructed entrance to the facility by parking their vehicles there. A CCTV footage showed people entering the hospital and physically abusing the staff. The staff and a 70-year-old man were allegedly injured.

84.title: Mumbai woman cheated of ₹2.3 lakh over 'friend's gifts' from Poland
84.article_body: A Mumbai-based woman was cheated of more than ₹2 lakh after a fraudster asked her to pay customs duty for ‘gifts’ he sent her from Poland. The complainant became ‘friends’ with the man on social media. The man initially asked her to pay ₹45,000 as customs duty and then threatened her with a money laundering case to pay more.

85.title: You're polluting minds of youngsters: SC to Ektaa Kapoor on 'XXX' web series
85.article_body: Supreme Court on Friday criticised producer Ektaa Kapoor over objectionable content in 'XXX' web series and said, "You're polluting the minds of the young generation of this country." The court added, "OTT content is available to all. What kind of choice are you providing to the people?" The web series faced criticism for reportedly featuring several objectionable scenes insulting Army.

86.title: Sonia won from Ballari in 1999 but she did not look at it again: Yediyurappa
86.article_body: Ex-CM BS Yediyurappa said that Congress President Sonia Gandhi was elected from Karnataka's Ballari in the 1999 general elections but she did not look at the constituency again. "When Rahul Gandhi comes to Ballari ask him why his mother never returned...You must...remember that...[BJP] has always made persons belonging to the SC/ST communities the President of the country," Yediyurappa said.

87.title: Pune Police to make SOP to investigate 'sextortion' cases
87.article_body: Pune Police said a standard operating procedure (SOP) is being prepared to investigate 'sextortion' cases. The decision comes after two students in separate incidents allegedly died by suicide in the last month in the Pune district. Later, the probe in the cases revealed they were victims of extortion where criminals threatened to leak their objectionable photos online.

88.title: Seat belts must for all Mumbai car passengers from Nov 1, violators to be punished
88.article_body: The Mumbai Police on Friday said wearing seat belts will be compulsory for drivers and co-passengers in four-wheeler vehicles from November 1. In a notification, police warned of action against violators under the Motor Vehicles (Amendment) Act. The notification further instructed all motorists and vehicle owners to install seat belt facility in four-wheelers before November 1.

89.title: 21-yr-old Virat Kohli fan murders Rohit Sharma fan following drunken brawl in TN, arrested
89.article_body: A 21-year-old Virat Kohli fan named Dharmaraj has been arrested for allegedly killing his friend Vignesh, who was a Rohit Sharma fan, following a drunken brawl in Tamil Nadu's Mallur over who was a better cricketer out of Kohli and Rohit. Police stated during their brawl, Vignesh mocked RCB and Kohli, and had made remarks comparing RCB to Dharmaraj's stammering.

90.title: I didn't, he blocked me: Charu on reports she unfollowed Rajeev on Instagram
90.article_body: Actress Charu Asopa has reacted to reports that claimed she unfollowed her husband Rajeev Sen on Instagram. "I did not unfollow him, he blocked me," she said. "He has gone to Delhi and waha jaane ke baad he...blocked me. I have no clue what he's doing or where he is," Charu added. The duo had earlier called off their divorce.

91.title: No action against senior bureaucrats involved in corruption in J&K: Mufti
91.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti on Friday criticised Jammu and Kashmir administration and said that no action has been taken against senior bureaucrats involved in corruption. Low rank officers are fired without any investigation, she said. Mufti's comment came after the government ordered premature retirement of 36 police personnel for their alleged involvement in corruption and lack of performance.

92.title: A champion in every sense: Yuvraj to Gambhir on his 41st birthday
92.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to wish Gautam Gambhir on his 41st birthday and wrote, "Wishing a very happy birthday to my dear brother Gautam Gambhir - a champion in every sense! Lots of love GG." Suresh Raina tweeted, "Wishing Gambhir all the love and success on his birthday today! A true friend and a gracious human being."

93.title: BMC begins demolition around Mahim Fort as part of restoration
93.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has begun the demolition of structures around the Mahim Fort as part of the restoration process. On Thursday, the BMC demolished 21 of the 267 residential structures and the rest will be demolished over the next month. "The fort is in an extremely dilapidated state...the civic body is manually carrying out the demolition," said an official.

94.title: UP CM visits flood-affected villages of Gorakhpur & Maharajganj
94.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Friday visited the flood-affected villages of Gorakhpur, Maharajganj and distributed relief materials to flood victims. "Facing the challenge of disaster firmly, the double engine government of the Centre and...state is engaged in the service of...people," he said. Officials have been asked to provide ₹4 lakh compensation to families of flood victims, he added.

95.title: PMC appoints new brand ambassadors for Swachh Survey 2023
95.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has appointed tennis player Rutuja Bhosale and singer Saleel Kulkarni as brand ambassadors for next year’s Swacch Survey. "To create awareness among the citizens and authorities, PMC has appointed these brand ambassadors," said municipal official Asha Raut. Bhosale and Kulkarni are expected to participate in the PMC’s cleanliness awareness programmes.

96.title: Protestors throw soup at Van Gogh's $84 mn painting, glue themselves to wall in UK
96.article_body: 'Just Stop Oil' activists threw soup over Vincent van Gogh's 'Sunflowers' painting, estimated to be worth over $84 million, at London's National Gallery, and appeared to glue themselves to the wall. It's protected by glass and wasn't damaged, the gallery said. "What's worth more, art or life? Is it worth more than food? More than justice?" said an activist.

97.title: India test-fires Submarine Launched Ballistic Missile from INS Arihant
97.article_body: India on Friday successfully test-fired a Submarine Launched Ballistic Missile (SLBM) from nuclear submarine INS Arihant. The Ministry of Defence said the missile was tested to a predetermined range and impacted the target area in the Bay of Bengal with very high accuracy. All operational and technological parameters of the weapon system have been validated, the ministry added.

98.title: Mind-blowing, a must-watch: Dhanush on Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara'
98.article_body: Actor Dhanush took to Twitter to praise Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara', saying, "Mind-blowing!! A must-watch." "Rishab Shetty, you should be very proud of yourself. Congratulations Hombale Films (production house)...keep pushing the boundaries. A big hug to all the actors and technicians of the film," he added. Besides playing the lead, Rishab has written and directed the film.

99.title: 'RIP Cartoon Network' trends as merger announced with Warner Bros, networks respond
99.article_body: Cartoon Network Studios fans trended 'RIP Cartoon Network' after it was announced that it'll merge with Warner Bros Animation and both labels will be run independently, albeit under the same President. People on Twitter mourned the 'killing' of Cartoon Network, even as its Art Director criticised a report for "spreading panic". Warner Brothers have also denied the channel is folding.

100.title: Shalin & I are simply making an effort to be cordial for our son: Dalljiet
100.article_body: After Bigg Boss 16 contestant Shalin Bhanot claimed that he and his ex-wife, Dalljiet, are best friends, the latter denied it, saying they're simply making an effort to be cordial for their son. Dalljiet added they only see each other because she wants their son to have a good relationship with Shalin and doesn't want him to witness Dalljiet-Shalin controversies.

101.title: Body of unidentified man found in Kolshet creek in Thane
101.article_body: The body of an unidentified man was found in the creek in Kolshet, Thane on Friday. The body was found at around 1 pm at Ganpati Visarjan ghat and further probe into the matter is being conducted by the police department, a civic official said. An accidental death case has been registered, a police official added.

102.title: Will accept whatever decision comes: Warner on captaincy restoration decision
102.article_body: Amid the talks about his lifetime ban from captaining Australia being revoked, batter David Warner said that he will accept whatever decision is being taken by Cricket Australia. "If it does get overturned, that'll be great for me...If I ever get presented with that (captain of the Australian white ball teams) opportunity, it will be a privilege," Warner said.

103.title: Touched at being called daughter of Assam by CM Sarma: Prez Murmu
103.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu said that she was touched by the gesture of Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma calling her a daughter of the state. "The welcome I have received here has made me feel at home and I will return soon," President Murmu said. She added that a society that respects its women is considered a civilised one.

104.title: Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation officers, staffers to get Diwali bonus
104.article_body: Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) Commissioner Rajesh Narvekar announced that officers and staffers of NMMC are set to get an ex-gratia payment before Diwali. As per the order, NMMC officers and employees, primary and secondary teachers will get a grant amount of ₹27,000. Similarly, employees and health workers on daily wages will be provided with an amount of ₹21,000.

105.title: Saudi Arabia pushed other OPEC nations into decision on oil cuts: US
105.article_body: The US has accused Saudi Arabia of pushing other OPEC+ nations into the decision to cut oil production target. The US National Security Council spokesperson John Kirby said more than one OPEC member disagreed with Saudi Arabia's decision and felt coerced into vote. "The Saudi foreign ministry can try to spin or deflect, but the facts are simple," Kirby added.

106.title: When father takes care of child, society blows it out of proportion: Neha Dhupia
106.article_body: Actress Neha Dhupia said she finds it "problematic" when people think that it's only her duty to take care of her kids. Neha said that after her daughter was born, people would look at her and ask, "Where's the baby? Who's watching over her?" "Society blows it out of proportion when the father...[takes care of the child]," she added.

107.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 2 persons involved in online fraud, cheating
107.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Friday arrested two persons, identified as Bhagwan Sahya Sharma and Sachin Saini, involved in online fraud and cheating. The accused, who hailed from Jaipur, reportedly targeted victims by sending fake messages asking them to update their bank documents. Police seized three mobile phones, six credit cards, four debit cards, one voter ID and  ₹50,000 cash.

108.title: Belarus in state of heightened terrorism alert: President Lukashenko
108.article_body: Belarusian President Aleksandr Lukashenko said that he had placed Belarus in a state of heightened terrorism alert because of tensions on its border with Ukraine. Lukashenko linked the decision to an announcement in which he ordered Belarusian troops to deploy with Russian forces near the southern border. "Everything is going according to plan," Lukashenko added.

109.title: UK Finance Minister Kwasi Kwarteng fired after less than 6 weeks on the job
109.article_body: UK Finance Minister Kwasi Kwarteng has been fired by PM Liz Truss after less than six weeks on the job, multiple reports said on Friday, amid market unrest over the government's massive tax cuts. Kwarteng became the UK's shortest-serving Chancellor of the Exchequer since 1970. The UK will now elect its fourth Finance Minister in as many months.

110.title: IT conducts raids at premises of JD(U) chief’s close aide in Patna
110.article_body: The Income Tax (IT) Department carried out searches at the premises of a builder, Gabbu Singh, who is a close aide of JD(U) National President Lalan Singh. The raids were conducted at the premises of the builder in Shivpuri, Patel Nagar and Boring Road. The development comes months after the JD(U) severed ties with the BJP and joined the Mahagathbandhan.

111.title: Drugs worth ₹900 crore seized since May 2021: Assam CM
111.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma has claimed that drugs worth ₹900 crore were seized and a total of 6,800 people have been arrested in the state since May 2021. Earlier on August 2, the Assam Police had seized drugs worth ₹15 crore in the Karbi Anglong district during a joint operation with the CRPF.

112.title: Videos of fog, flooded roads in B'luru emerge online after heavy rain
112.article_body: Videos and pictures showing thick fog and mist in Bengaluru on Friday morning after heavy rain in the city have emerged on social media. "Visibility is hardly 50 metres," a Twitter user wrote. Visuals of waterlogged roads in areas like Indiranagar were also shared online by locals. The rain also led to traffic congestion on Outer Ring Road on Thursday.

113.title: 29-yr-old Delhi man caught with 103 kg firecrackers despite ban, arrested
113.article_body: A 29-year-old man was arrested for carrying around 103-kilograms of firecrackers with the intention to sell them despite the ban in the national capital. While patrolling the Sadar Bazar area, police noticed the man carrying plastic bags. Upon checking, they found firecrackers in the bag. He said he brought firecrackers from Lucknow to the national capital for sale.

114.title: KL Rahul could be top run-scorer for India at T20 WC 2022: Aakash Chopra
114.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said opener KL Rahul could be the top run-scorer for India at upcoming T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. "He has an opportunity to bat all 20 overs, and...also has the game to bat till the end. These pitches will suit him a lot as the ball will come nicely onto the bat," he added.

115.title: No plans to buy Jaiprakash Associates' cement unit: Adani Enterprises
115.article_body: Adani Enterprises clarified it is not evaluating plans to buy Jaiprakash Associates' cement unit. This development comes amid reports that the firm was in advanced discussion with Jaiprakash Power Ventures to acquire its cement unit for around ₹5,000 crore. Adani Enterprises said, "Company isn't evaluating any such proposal...not in a position to comment on the veracity of said media report."

116.title: India-UK FTA no longer has a Diwali deadline: UK Trade Secretary
116.article_body: India-UK free trade agreement (FTA) is no longer working towards a Diwali deadline, UK Trade Secretary Kemi Badenoch said. "We're still working on a deal...things that have changed...we're no longer working to the Diwali deadline," Badenoch said. This comes amid reports of possible deadlock over issues like data localisation and UK firms being allowed to bid for Indian government contracts.

117.title: 9 students drown after ferry capsizes in Cambodia
117.article_body: At least nine children in southern Cambodia who were crossing a river died after the boat they were on capsized on Thursday, officials said. The students, aged between 12 and 14, were on their way to an English class when their boat capsized on the Mekong River. Four people, two students and two of the boat's crew, have been rescued.

118.title: Photographer captures 'ghost rainbow' in US, pic goes viral
118.article_body: A photographer named Stu Berman shared the photo of a 'ghost rainbow' captured by him in California. Also called fogbow or white rainbow, it's caused by the same physical process as the rainbow, except the water droplets that form the fogbow are very small. This causes heightened diffraction that leads to the appearance of weak colours or no colours.

119.title: Will approach SC: Lawyer after Gyanvapi 'Shivling' carbon dating rejection
119.article_body: After a Varanasi Court rejected the plea of Hindu worshippers regarding carbon dating of 'Shivling' in the Gyanvapi mosque case, Advocate Vishnu Jain said that they will now move to Supreme Court against this order and challenge it there. "I cannot announce the date as of now, but we'll soon challenge this order in Supreme Court," he added.

120.title: Couple blackmails MLAs, film producers using intimate pics & extort crores in Odisha
120.article_body: A woman in her 20s and her husband were recently arrested for allegedly extorting crores of rupees from influential people such as MLAs, businessmen and film producers in Odisha, police said. The couple, identified as Archana Nag and Jagabandu Chand, allegedly ran a sex racket to extort influential persons by threatening to make their intimate pictures public.

121.title: Felt cheated, nobody expected it to be animated film: Vishnu on 'Adipurush'
121.article_body: Telugu actor Vishnu Manchu said in an interview that he "felt cheated" when he saw the teaser of 'Adipurush'. He added that nobody expected it to be an animated film. "We all thought...it'll be a mainstream live-action movie," said Vishnu. "If you would've said...it was an animated film, and then released the teaser, there would've been zero trolls," he added.

122.title: Class 10 boy's kidneys swell after being forced to do 200 sit-ups in Guj school
122.article_body: A Class 10 student was hospitalised after he was allegedly made to do 200 sit-ups as punishment by a school teacher in Gujarat's Una. The boy has been diagnosed with swelling in his kidneys. His father alleged that about seven to 10 days ago, when his son returned from school, he complained of cramps in his legs and vomited constantly.

123.title: Never thought we would see 4 sixes in final over at T20 WC 2016: Sammy
123.article_body: Ex-West Indies skipper Daren Sammy remembered the last over of the 2016 T20 World Cup final where Carlos Brathwaite helped his team to win the title by smashing four sixes. "I remember Chris [Gayle] saying that 19 [runs in the last over] is a lot. But...Man oh man, I never thought we would see four [consecutive] sixes," Sammy said.

124.title: Rasika Dugal wraps up shooting for 'Mirzapur 3'
124.article_body: Actress Rasika Dugal has completed shooting for the third season of the web series 'Mirzapur'. The actress, who plays a character named Beena Tripathi on the show, said that she will miss being on the sets and collaborating with her "favourite people". In addition to Rasika, 'Mirzapur 3' will also feature Pankaj Tripathi and Ali Fazal, among others.

125.title: Govt says OTP can be stolen via calls, urges public to stay alert & aware
125.article_body: Press Information Bureau shared a video on Twitter saying that One Time Password (OTP) can be stolen via calls. "Never merge any other calls while talking to a stranger on the phone...Once the call is merged, the fraudster can hack your social media account by knowing the OTP...Be aware, be alert," the tweet read.

126.title: Crimea bridge repairs will be completed by July next year: Russia
126.article_body: Repairs to the bridge linking southern Russia with the annexed Crimean peninsula will be completed by July 2023, a document published on the Russian government's website said. The bridge was damaged in an explosion last Saturday. Russian President Vladimir Putin blamed Ukraine's special services for the Crimea bridge blast and called it an "act of terrorism".

127.title: Russia to evacuate Kherson residents amid Ukraine's advances
127.article_body: Russian Deputy Prime Minister Marat Khusnullin announced that the country would provide free accommodation to residents of the Kherson region who want to evacuate to Russia. The announcement came after Russia-backed leader of Kherson, one of the Ukrainian regions annexed by Russia, asked the Kremlin to organise evacuation. The request came after Ukrainian forces began counteroffensive in Kherson.

128.title: Mohammad Shami replaces Jasprit Bumrah in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad
128.article_body: The BCCI on Friday named fast bowler Mohammad Shami as Jasprit Bumrah's replacement in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad. Shami has reached Australia and will link up with the squad in Brisbane ahead of the warm-up matches, the BCCI said. Further, Mohammed Siraj and Shardul Thakur have been named as backups and will travel to Australia shortly.

129.title: Electric vehicle makers face penalty after probe into recent fire incidents
129.article_body: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways has imposed a penalty on EV makers after an investigation into several two-wheelers catching fire, a report said. The government had formed high-level committee to review testing standards after at least 10 incidents of fire in EVs were reported between March and June. Penalty imposed under Central Motor Vehicles Rules has been collected.

130.title: 25-yr-old man climbs building via pipes, records girl taking bath in Goa; held
130.article_body: A 25-year-old man, Cipson Gomes, has been arrested for allegedly climbing on a building using pipes and recording a video of a girl while she was taking bath in Goa. Reports said that the video was taken when the girl was taking a bath in the washroom of a girls' hostel, reports added.

131.title: I-T Dept raids stores of garment retailer RS Brothers in Hyderabad
131.article_body: The Income Tax Department on Friday conducted searches at multiple stores and offices of garment and jewellery retailer RS Brothers. As per reports, raids were conducted over investments made by the company in the real estate business. Income Tax officials reportedly checked the transactions made by RS Brothers. They also searched the offices of some real estate firms.

132.title: Worked every day for 8 years, was depressed; developed health issues: Nargis
132.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri said that she worked every single day for eight years. "I hardly got to be with my family. I felt unwell due to stress. Consequently, I developed health issues. Was I depressed? I guess you can use the word. I was unhappy in my situation...I took two years off to get healthy," she added.

133.title: Thought I'll reach my peak at 24: 21-yr-old Swiatek after her 61st win in 2022
133.article_body: After her Tour-leading 61st win of the year, world number one Iga Swiatek said, "I wasn't expecting to have this kind of season this year." She added, "I thought, maybe, I'm going to be at my peak when I'm 24, 25." The 21-year-old's 61 wins are the most in a single season since Caroline Wozniacki's 60 in 2017.

134.title: US-based Bitcoin firm NYDIG lays off around 33% of its staff: Report
134.article_body: US-based Bitcoin company NYDIG laid off 110 employees, a third of its workforce, last month to cut costs, The Wall Street Journal reported. The company took the decision weeks before replacing its top two executives. Last year, NYDIG raised $1 billion in a funding round which increased the company's valuation to more than $7 billion.

135.title: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's security upgraded to 'Z+'
135.article_body: The Centre has upgraded the security of Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma from the 'Z' category cover to the 'Z+' category on an India basis. According to reports, the move comes after the security arrangement was reviewed by the Union Home Ministry. Sarma will be guarded by over 50 commandos whenever he travels within the country.

136.title: NCLT approves ArcelorMittal's ₹4,050-cr resolution plan for Uttam Galva
136.article_body: NCLT's Mumbai bench has reportedly approved the ₹4,050-crore resolution plan by ArcelorMittal's Indian arm for the debt-ridden Uttam Galva Steels. After Essar Steel and Odisha Slurry Pipeline Infrastructure, this is ArcelorMittal's third purchase through the insolvency process. NCLT had admitted an insolvency petition against Uttam Galva on SBI's plea in October 2020.

137.title: Infosys not to mandate return to office, flexible approach to continue: CEO
137.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh said the company has not mandated any fixed number of days that employees need to attend office physically and will continue with its flexible approach. "In our India offices, we have about 45,000 employees in the office at any given time...We are finding that the approach taken so far has been well received," Parekh said.

138.title: Govt to launch 5th Vande Bharat train on November 10: Reports
138.article_body: The fifth Vande Bharat Express train is likely to be launched on November 10 and would run on the Chennai-Bengaluru-Mysuru route. According to reports, the train will cover a total distance of 483 km. Earlier on Thursday, Prime Minister Narendra Modi flagged off the fourth edition of Vande Bharat Express at the Amb Andaura railway station in Himachal Pradesh.

139.title: NGT imposes ₹500 cr fine on K'taka for failure to protect Chandapura lake
139.article_body: The National Green Tribunal (NGT) has imposed an environmental compensation fine of ₹500 crore on the Karnataka government for its failure in protecting Chandapura lake in Anekal taluka. "The state has failed to protect the environment...Lake ecology and ecosystem have hugely suffered. The state is thus, to be held liable to pay environmental compensation," NGT said.

140.title: We will not be intimidated by nuclear threats: NATO to Russia
140.article_body: NATO Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg on Thursday said the military alliance "will not be intimidated" by Russia's nuclear threats. "Russia's nuclear rhetoric is dangerous, reckless and they know that if they use [a] nuclear weapon against Ukraine, it will have severe consequences," he added. Stoltenberg also said that NATO will "very closely" monitor Russia's upcoming annual nuclear exercise.

141.title: 2 arrested in UP for objectionable remarks against Mulayam Singh
141.article_body: Two men have been arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Ballia district for allegedly making objectionable remarks on Facebook against Samajwadi Party founder Mulayam Singh Yadav, who passed away earlier this week. According to police, the accused compared Yadav to Ravana, the demon king in Ramayana. Both accused, Markandeya Swarnkar and Ajay Verma, are residents of Nagra, said police.

142.title: Pitbull dog attacks 11-year-old girl in Ghaziabad
142.article_body: A pitbull dog reportedly attacked an 11-year-old girl in Civitech Society in Ghaziabad on Wednesday. She was playing and taking a stroll along with her pets in the society when the dog bit her on both legs. Her family claimed negligence by the dog's owner as it was left out without a leash. The girl was taken to a hospital.

143.title: Rowdy sheeter arrested in Hyderabad; dummy pistol, dagger seized
143.article_body: The Hyderabad Detective Department Special Team (south) arrested a rowdy sheeter and seized a dagger and a dummy pistol from him. According to the police, 30-year-old Shaik Ahmed Bin Omar Bawazeer was absconding after a case was booked against him for outraging modesty of a woman. He was also allegedly involved in four cases, including two murder cases.

144.title: Bombay High Court acquits ex-DU professor GN Saibaba in UAPA case
144.article_body: Bombay High Court's Nagpur bench on Friday acquitted former Delhi University professor GN Saibaba in a UAPA case and ordered his immediate release from Nagpur Central Jail. The court also allowed the appeal of five other convicts in the case and acquitted them. Saibaba was convicted for alleged Maoist links in 2017 and sentenced to life imprisonment.

145.title: Mumbai gym trainer held for cheating woman of ₹13 lakh by promising visa
145.article_body: A 28-year-old gym trainer, who cheated a 30-year-old woman of ₹13 lakh by promising to get her a Canadian visa, has been arrested in Mumbai, police said. The complainant had hired the accused, Kiran Mandavkar, as her personal gym trainer two years ago, to whom she paid ₹13 lakh till November 2021. "We're...investigating if he cheated more persons," police said.

146.title: Pakistani senator arrested for tweeting against Army chief Bajwa
146.article_body: A senior member of ousted Pakistani PM Imran Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf has been arrested for a "highly obnoxious and intimidating" tweet against the country's Army chief, General Qamar Javed Bajwa. After a court acquitted PM Shehbaz Sharif and his son in a money laundering case on Wednesday, Senator Azam Swati congratulated Bajwa for "freeing criminals" and "legitimising corruption".

147.title: Talk of UK exit speculative, engaging with govt on subsidy: Tata Steel
147.article_body: Amid news reports of Tata Steel's exit from the UK market, CFO Koushik Chatterjee said the company is still actively engaging with the UK government regarding the subsidy issue and any talk of exit is speculative, Moneycontrol reported. Tata Steel UK has asked for £1.5 billion from British government for the transition to green energy, without which it might exit.

148.title: 1 lakh jobs, old pension scheme if we form govt in Himachal: Priyanka
148.article_body: Congress General Secretary Priyanka Gandhi Vadra on Friday promised one lakh government jobs and implementation of the old pension scheme if the party is voted to power in the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. Addressing a rally in Solan, Gandhi said, "BJP doesn't have money for pension but can waive off loans of their big businessmen."

149.title: PMC, NHAI form teams to stop dumping of garbage around highways
149.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) have formed vigilance teams in a joint operation to stop the dumping of garbage around highways and service roads. "Our teams...filed 94 cases so far and collected ₹65,490 in fines," PMC Deputy Commissioner (Solid Waste Management Department) Asha Raut said. The PMC also urged people to not dump waste.

150.title: WPI inflation falls to 10.7% in Sept, in double digits for 18 straight months
150.article_body: India's wholesale price index (WPI)-based inflation eased to 10.7% in September, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry data showed. WPI remained in the double digits for the 18th consecutive month beginning April 2021. WPI inflation surged to 12.41% during August, while it was revised to 14.07% from 13.93% for July, the data showed. WPI inflation in September 2021 was 11.80%.

151.title: Ekta Kapoor's Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO Zulfiqar Khan missing in Kenya since July
151.article_body: Ekta Kapoor's Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO Zulfiqar Khan has been missing in Nairobi, Kenya, since July this year. The 48-year-old went on holiday and was due to return on July 24. However, he dropped out of contact on July 21. The family has written to the government to trace him and also started an online campaign #BringZulfiBack.

152.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till Oct 18, list released
152.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs. It  is very likely over Andaman & Nicobar Islands, Tamil Nadu, Puducherry and Kerala from October 15 to 18. Further, Telangana may witness it on October 15 and Karnataka may witness it from October 15 to 17. Lakshadweep may witness it on October 18.

153.title: Hindu Sena files PIL in Delhi HC against Om Raut's 'Adipurush'
153.article_body: A PIL has been filed in Delhi HC against Om Raut's upcoming movie 'Adipurush', seeking removal of 'objectionable content' related to Lord Ram, Hanuman, Raavan and others. The plea has been moved by National President of Hindu Sena, Vishnu Gupta. It states that the movie has hurt the sentiments of Hindu community by depicting religious figures in an inappropriate manner.

154.title: Video of 'idli ATM' vending idlis 24×7 in Bengaluru goes viral
154.article_body: A video of an 'idli ATM' vending idlis 24×7 in Bengaluru has gone viral on social media. The automated idli-making machine, which is set up by Bengaluru-based startup Freshot Robotics, can reportedly prepare and dispense 72 packaged idlis and chutney in 12 minutes. The video showed a customer scanning the QR code placed near the ATM to place her order.

155.title: Indian Army dog ‘Zoom’ passes away, officers lay wreath on mortal remains
155.article_body: Indian Army assault dog 'Zoom' passed away on Thursday. Army officers on Friday laid a wreath on the mortal remains of the assault dog 'Zoom'. The army canine passed away while he was under treatment after he was shot twice during an operation in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag, reports said.

156.title: Himachal Pradesh Assembly poll dates released, voting on November 12
156.article_body: Voting for Assembly polls in Himachal Pradesh will take place in one phase on November 12, the Election Commission of India (ECI) said on Friday. Counting of votes will be held on December 8, it said, adding that the last date for nominations is October 25. Dates for the Gujarat Assembly elections were not announced on Friday.

157.title: I would never write off WI, something special will happen in Aus: Sammy
157.article_body: Ex-West Indies skipper Daren Sammy said that he would never write off the Caribbean team in a tournament and feels something special will happen in the T20 World Cup in Australia. "Kyle Mayers is such a talent...and we know Nicholas [Pooran] is a match-winner. The good thing this time round is we have bowlers who can take wickets," Sammy said.

158.title: Workers beat BJP corporator's husband in MP police station; video surfaces
158.article_body: A video of sanitation workers and their relatives purportedly beating a BJP corporator's husband at a police station in Madhya Pradesh's Indore has surfaced online. The incident occurred when the corporator's husband was called to the police station after the workers came to file a complaint against him for allegedly abusing a female worker over the phone.

159.title: It doesn't bother me: Sidharth on wedding rumours with Kiara
159.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, when asked if the rumours about his wedding with actress Kiara Advani bother him, said, "No, it doesn't." He added he doesn't think there's anything to be bothered about after being in the film industry for 10 years. Sidharth further said if he was getting married, it would be very difficult to keep it a secret today.

160.title: Man enters house in Bihar's Bettiah and opens fire, 4 injured
160.article_body: A man entered a house in Bihar's Bettiah and opened fire injuring four persons on Thursday, police said. "One man entered a house and shot four people in the Jogapatti Police Station area. The accused was nabbed with the help of villagers," police added. A bullet hit the throat of one of the victims and he has been hospitalised.

161.title: I'd like to see Australia, India, Pakistan in T20 WC semi-finals: Akram
161.article_body: Ahead of T20 World Cup 2022, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram backed India, Pakistan and Australia to play in the semi-finals of the tournament in Australia. "But South Africa could be a dark horse," said Akram. India failed to reach the knockout stage in the 2021 edition. Australia are the defending champions. World Cup will begin on Sunday.

162.title: Infosys let go of employees working for two companies in last 12 months: CEO
162.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh has revealed that the company let go of employees who were found to be working at two specific companies in the last 12 months. The fired employees were working for companies where there were issues regarding confidentiality, Parekh added. Last month, Wipro fired around 300 employees who were working directly for the IT company's competitors.

163.title: BJP leader urinates on district president's banner in MP; expelled as video goes viral
163.article_body: A video showing BJP leader Shailendra Bhadauria urinating on party's district president Devendra Singh Narwaria in Madhya Pradesh's Bhind has gone viral on social media. BJP has expelled Bhadauria from the primary membership of the party for 6 years. BJP State General Secretary Bhagwandas Sabnani said that the act is highly indecent and condemnable, which the party will never tolerate.

164.title: Only 2 Indian startups turned unicorn in Q3 amid slow funding: PwC
164.article_body: Shiprocket and OneCard are the only two Indian startups to turn unicorn in Q3 2022 amid slowdown in funding, PwC India reported. The July-September period produced 20 unicorns globally and 45% of them were from SaaS segment. "The global slowdown in funding continues with startup funding in India in Q3 CY22 hitting two-year low at $2.7 billion," the report added.

165.title: Senior citizen, son hacked to death at home in Hyderabad
165.article_body: A man aged about 75 years and his son were reportedly hacked to death at their home by two unidentified assailants in Hyderabad's Uppal on Friday morning. The son, who was about 40 years old, had recently returned from Malaysia. According to a police officer, differences between family members due to property disputes could have led to the murder.

166.title: 17 K'taka forest officials booked for custodial death of tribal man
166.article_body: As many as 17 officials of Karnataka Forest Department have been booked over the custodial death of a tribal man in Mysuru, said police. The suspects took the victim, 41-year-old Kariyappa, into illegal custody accusing him of killing a deer in the reserve forest, added police. The victim was allegedly assaulted and later taken to a hospital, where he died.

167.title: Chhath Puja to be celebrated at 1,100 places in Delhi; ₹25 crore allocated
167.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal announced that the government would organise Chhath Puja at 1,100 places this year and has also allocated ₹25 crore for the festival. The amount will be used for arrangements like power backup, ambulances, washrooms, etc. The CM said that the government is making all efforts to ensure that devotees celebrate on a grand scale.

168.title: Winner of India-Pak match will reach T20 WC 2022 semis: Aakash Chopra
168.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra said the team emerging victorious in the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Pakistan on October 23, will reach the semi-finals of the tournament. "We say that Pakistan drop so many catches but the fact is that we drop more catches than them," Aakash had earlier stated while discussing Team India's fielding.

169.title: 'Radicalised teenager' kills 2 people outside gay bar in Slovakia
169.article_body: A "radicalised teenager" shot dead two people outside a gay bar in Slovakia's capital Bratislava on Wednesday evening, PM Eduard Heger said. "No form of white supremacy, racism and extremism against communities, including LGBTI, can be tolerated...We will fight disinformation channels spreading hate and protect minorities," Heger added. The suspected gunman was found dead on Thursday, police said.

170.title: SAT stays SEBI's shut down order against Brickwork Ratings: Report
170.article_body: The Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) has reportedly put a stay on SEBI's decision ordering Brickwork Ratings India to wind up operations within six months. The final hearing of the case will be held on November 15. SEBI had instructed Brickwork to not take on fresh clients for "failure to exercise proper skill, care and diligence...duties as a credit rating agency".

171.title: Govt not running Zomato, collect your aid: UP DM to flood-hit people
171.article_body: In a viral video, UP's Ambedkar Nagar District Magistrate Samuel Paul N was seen telling flood-hit people to collect relief material themselves as "the government is not running Zomato" to provide door-to-door service. "You will be provided with chlorine tablets, and a doctor will come to see when one falls sick. This is why flood posts are established," he said.

172.title: India picked too many spinners for WC, Umran should've been taken: Arun
172.article_body: Ex-Team India bowling coach Bharat Arun said Team India have picked "far too many" spinners for the T20 World Cup 2022, adding that selecting pacer Umran Malik instead of one spinner would've been "very wise". "There's bounce, the grounds are big...Umran is exciting, he's got the pace...and given the right kind of fields he's done...well in the IPL," he stated.

173.title: No scientific probe of 'Shivling' inside Gyanvapi Mosque as UP court rejects plea
173.article_body: A Varanasi court on Friday rejected the plea of Hindu worshippers to conduct a scientific probe into the contested structure inside the Gyanvapi Mosque. The plea has been rejected in view of the Supreme Court order to seal the alleged Shivling that was found during the court-mandated videography of the premises. Court arguments in the matter concluded last week.

174.title: Layoffs will be the absolute last thing at Zoho, it destroys loyalty: CEO
174.article_body: Software startup Zoho's CEO Sridhar Vembu said that layoffs will be the "absolute last thing" that the company will ever consider. "It kind of destroys loyalty...If we want our employees to be loyal, we have to be loyal to them," the billionaire explained. Vembu further said that even when the times are tough, the company needs to retain its talent.
