175.title: 10 houses develop cracks during work at metro tunnel in Kolkata
175.article_body: At least 10 houses in Kolkata's Bowbazar developed cracks due to water seepage during work at the East-West Metro tunnel on Friday. Residents of these houses have been shifted to nearby hotels, Kolkata Metro Rail Corporation General Manager (Administration and HR) AK Nandy said. The buildings in Bowbazar had developed cracks due to metro work in May also.

176.title: SpaceX says it cannot fund Starlink in Ukraine, seeks funding from US govt
176.article_body: SpaceX, in a letter to the Pentagon, said that it can no longer donate or fund Starlink terminals for Ukraine. The Elon Musk-led company has requested the US government to take over funding for Ukraine's government and military use of Starlink. SpaceX estimates that providing Starlink in Ukraine will cost more than $120 million for the rest of the year.

177.title: Musk is under federal probe over his conduct in $44 billion deal, says Twitter
177.article_body: Twitter has claimed that the world's richest person Elon Musk is being investigated by federal authorities over his conduct in his $44-billion takeover deal. Attorneys for the Tesla CEO claimed "investigative privilege" when refusing to hand over documents, Twitter said in a court filing. "This game of 'hide the ball' must end," the company, which sued Musk in July, added.

178.title: 3 employees of investment firm booked for cheating senior citizen in Thane
178.article_body: Three employees of an investment firm were booked for allegedly cheating a senior citizen of more than ₹75 lakh in Thane, Maharashtra. The 69-year-old victim alleged that the accused wooed him to invest on the promise of lucrative returns, which he never got, police said. The accused were the public relations officer, regional manager and head manager of the firm.

179.title: 'Kantara' beats 'KGF 2', becomes highest rated Indian film on IMDb
179.article_body: Kannada film 'Kantara', starring Rishab Shetty, has become the highest-rated Indian film on IMDb, surpassing 'KGF Chapter 2'. 'Kantara' currently has a rating of 9.5 on IMDb, followed by 'KGF Chapter 2' (8.4) and SS Rajamouli's 'RRR' (8). Directed by Rishab Shetty, 'Kantara' deals with the issues of land and ownership.

180.title: Taxi driver arrested for stalking & harassing 3 schoolgirls in Mumbai
180.article_body: Police have arrested a 35-year-old taxi driver for allegedly harassing and stalking three schoolgirls in Mumbai's Colaba. Teachers of a municipal school approached the police on Wednesday, alleging that the accused had been making objectionable gestures at the girls for the last three to four days. The court has sent him to judicial custody for 14 days.

181.title: Look to score vs Shaheen, don't just survive: Gambhir to India batters
181.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Team India's batters should look to score runs against Pakistan's Shaheen Afridi rather than simply looking to survive, when the teams face off in the T20 World Cup 2022 on October 23. "The moment you look to survive, everything becomes really small...Team India [have] got...quality batters in their top...four who can definitely take on Shaheen," added Gambhir.

182.title: T'gana CM KCR busy with his political agenda: BJP's Ponguleti Sudhakar
182.article_body: BJP leader Ponguleti Sudhakar Reddy criticised the TRS government for luring voters despite heavy rains in parts of Telangana. He also accused CM KCR of being busy with his political agenda. "The ministers are busy luring voters in Munugode. Is this governance? Is this the Telangana model? This government is not for the common man," said Sudhakar.

183.title: Greater Noida Police arrest two for assaulting 59-year-old man
183.article_body: The Greater Noida Police arrested two staff members of a society for allegedly thrashing a 59-year-old man. The victim, Pratap Singh, has sustained injuries on his head and back. "The plumber and electrician of the society got into an argument with the victim, which turned violent and the victim was allegedly beaten with sticks by the suspects," said the police.

184.title: Can't operate without Gandhis, have to take their guidance: Kharge
184.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge, who will be contesting the party's Presidential election, told Indian Express during an interview that "without the Gandhis, you can't (operate)…you have to take their guidance". Kharge said this on being asked about how a "non-Gandhi presidency" would work. "[Gandhi's] have sacrificed for this country. Even the positions (they have taken)," he further said.

185.title: Chivas Regal maker's India head steps down due to health reasons
185.article_body: Chivas Regal maker Pernod Ricard's India head, Thibault Cuny, has stepped down from his role due to health reasons, the French spirits giant said. The company said Cuny will take a break from his professional duties but will stay on with Pernod. Cuny took over as the Managing Director and CEO of Pernod Ricard South Asia in 2019.

186.title: NASA shares pic of dust 'fingerprint' created by 2 stars that meet once every 8 years
186.article_body: NASA has released a picture of "fingerprint-like pattern" formed by two giant stars that come together about once every eight years. The image, captured by James Webb Space Telescope, shows at least 17 concentric dust rings. Each ring was created when the two stars came close together and their stellar winds met, compressing the gas and forming dust, NASA said.

187.title: US-based 6sense fires 150 workers globally, including India: Report
187.article_body: US-based AI firm 6sense has fired close to 150 employees globally, including India, citing uncertain macroeconomic conditions, Moneycontrol reported. The layoffs happened across teams including content, design, sales and marketing. Employees were reportedly offered to encash privilege leaves as part of severance package. The Tiger Global-backed company is currently valued at $5.2 billion.

188.title: S Korea scrambles jets as 10 N Korean military aircraft fly close to border
188.article_body: South Korea scrambled fighter jets after 10 North Korean military aircraft flew close to the border dividing two countries, South Korean Joint Chiefs of Staff said in a statement. The North Korean aircraft were flying 25 km north of the Military Demarcation Line. The statement added that South Korean air force conducted an emergency sortie and maintained a response posture.

189.title: Expected justice, not verdict from SC: Student expelled over hijab
189.article_body: Udupi student Aliya Assadi, who was expelled for wearing hijab, said she was expecting justice from the Supreme Court, not the split verdict that came. Assadi was among the first to challenge the hijab ban in Karnataka High Court. Assadi appreciated Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia's remarks saying it "represented our struggle, allowing us to get our education with our constitutional values".

190.title: Prithvi Shaw smashes highest T20 score by an Indian in 2022
190.article_body: Mumbai opener Prithvi Shaw on Friday smashed the highest T20 score by an Indian in 2022. The 22-year-old slammed 134(61), including 13 fours and nine sixes, against Assam in Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy. The previous highest T20 score by an Indian in 2022 was registered by Karnataka opener Devdutt Padikkal, who slammed 124*(62) against Maharashtra on Tuesday.

191.title: Young boy sits on pilot's seat, holds control wheel of moving plane in Guj; video viral
191.article_body: A video showing a young boy sitting on a pilot's seat and holding the control wheel of a moving aircraft reportedly at Surat airport in Gujarat is going viral online. The aircraft, which is believed to be a single-engine plane, can be seen moving on a runway while the boy takes instructions from the pilot sitting next to him.

192.title: At least 11 killed, dozens injured in bus explosion in Mali
192.article_body: At least 11 people were killed and dozens were injured in an explosion on a bus in central Mali on Thursday, according to a hospital source. The bus hit an explosive device while travelling the road between Bandiagara and Goundaka, in the Mopti area, known as a hotbed for jihadist violence. Mali has been fighting Islamist insurgency since 2012.

193.title: 2 more minors file POCSO case against rape-accused seer Shivamurthy Murugha
193.article_body: Karnataka Police registered a POCSO case against seer Shivamurthy Murugha Sharanaru, Sri Murugha Mutt's chief pontiff, as two more minors have accused him of rape and sexual assault. Police have registered an FIR against seven people. The seer was earlier arrested after two minors, studying and staying at the Mutt's hostel in Chitradurga, accused him of rape and sexual assault.

194.title: Doctor removes 23 contact lenses from woman's eye who 'forgot' to take them off in US
194.article_body: A doctor in US' California removed 23 contact lenses from an eye of a patient and shared a video of the procedure on Instagram. "A rare occasion when someone 'forgot' to remove contact lenses at night and kept on putting a new one in every morning. 23 days in a row," the doctor wrote in her post.

195.title: UP minister's nephew held for trying to ram car into restaurant staff
195.article_body: Uttar Pradesh minister Arun Kumar's nephew who allegedly tried to ram his car into a group of restaurant workers in Bareilly has been arrested, police said on Friday. The incident occurred after the restaurant staff apparently refused to serve the accused. "The police must act as per the law, and there should be no laxity on this," Kumar told PTI.

196.title: Infosys shares surge 5% after Q2 results, ₹9,300-cr buyback news
196.article_body: A day after Infosys reported an 11.1% year-on-year surge in quarterly net profit at ₹6,021 crore, its shares rose by 5% on Friday. At 11:10 am, Infosys' stock was trading 5.11% higher at ₹ 1,492.30 apiece on the BSE. Its revenue from operations surged 23.4% to ₹36,538 crore. Infosys will also buy back shares worth ₹9,300 crore to reward shareholders.

197.title: BJP leader fined ₹800 for defying govt order after Akhlaq lynching
197.article_body: A fine of ₹800 has been imposed on BJP leader Sangeet Som after he was found guilty of violating the government's order in Uttar Pradesh's Bisahda village following Mohammad Akhlaq's lynching in 2015. Som had reportedly addressed a crowd of over hundreds of people in the wake of Akhlaq's death while CrPC Section 144 was in place in the area.

198.title: Turkish MP smashes phone with hammer in Parliament to protest new media bill
198.article_body: A Turkish lawmaker smashed his mobile phone with a hammer while speaking in Parliament. Burak Erbay, a member of the opposition Republican People's Party, was protesting against a proposed government-backed bill that aims to combat online "disinformation". As per the legislation, journalists and social media users could be jailed for up to three years for spreading fake news.

199.title: Lifestyle's new campaign aims to inspire customers to groove in style
199.article_body: Lifestyle announced the launch of its festive campaign that aims to encourage fashion lovers to elevate their style with the brand's new collection ahead of the seasonal celebrations. Shoppers will get a Portico bedsheet worth ₹2,499 for ₹799* on minimum shopping of ₹5,000 along with 10% cashback with HDFC cards on shopping worth ₹7,500*.

200.title: World's first space tourist Dennis Tito, his wife buy tickets to fly around Moon
200.article_body: Dennis Tito, who became the world's first-ever space tourist in 2001, and his wife Akiko have purchased two tickets on SpaceX's Starship rocket to fly around the Moon on a week-long mission. The couple paid an undisclosed amount and will travel with 10 other passengers. At 82, Tito could become the oldest person to go into orbit and deep space.

201.title: Superspreader of lies: Jairam after Shah blames Nehru for J&K issue
201.article_body: After Union Minister Amit Shah blamed former PM Jawaharlal Nehru's "mistake" of inserting Article 370 for the "mess" in Jammu and Kashmir, Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said, "Nehru didn't dictatorially insert Article 370...It was discussed, unlike notebandi (demonetisation)." He added that Shah is "as much a superspreader of lies as his Saheb". "Nobody resigned over it," he further said.

202.title: Man stabs wife to death over daughter's disobedience in Ghaziabad
202.article_body: A case was filed after a man allegedly stabbed his wife to death after getting infuriated over his daughter's disobedience in Ghaziabad's Masuri, police said on Thursday. The man had asked his daughter to get a bedsheet but she didn't as she was playing, Additional SP (Rural) Iraj Raja said. The wife succumbed to her injuries during treatment, Raja added.

203.title: Dera chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh granted 40-day parole
203.article_body: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh has been granted parole for 40 days. He is currently serving prison sentence in Haryana's Sunaria jail. The move has come ahead of upcoming Adampur bypolls. He had earlier come out of prison in February and June. He is serving a 20-year jail term for raping two women in his Sirsa ashram.

204.title: Iraqi Parliament elects Abdul Latif Rashid as new President
204.article_body: Lawmakers in Iraq on Thursday elected Abdul Latif Rashid as the country's new President, paving the way for the formation of a new government and ending a year of deadlock after October 2021 election. Soon after being elected, Rashid named Mohamed Shia al-Sudani as PM. Thursday's vote took place shortly after at least nine rockets landed around Baghdad's Green Zone.

205.title: Meta seeks dismissal of US FTC lawsuit over VR company acquisition
205.article_body: Meta on Thursday asked a federal court to dismiss a lawsuit filed by the US Federal Trade Commission (FTC) against its proposed acquisition of California-based VR firm Within Unlimited and its fitness app Supernatural. The lawsuit, filed in July, said the deal would hurt competition in VR fitness market. Meta said the lawsuit is "ill-conceived" and "relies on pure speculation".

206.title: AAP has an old habit of doing drama: CT Ravi on Gopal Italia's remark
206.article_body: Reacting to AAP leader Gopal Italia's recent remark against temples, BJP leader CT Ravi criticised the party and said that the AAP has an old habit of doing drama. "The people of Gujarat are intelligent, they know that AAP is doing drama...The Gujaratis have always been with PM Modi and they will be in the future also," said Ravi.

207.title: Karnataka-proposed EV hub to house 1,000 startups: Ashwath Narayan
207.article_body: Karnataka government's proposed EV industry hub will house about 1,000 startups, Minister of Information Technology and Biotechnology, CN Ashwath Narayan said. While addressing a conference, Narayan said five centres will be set up to facilitate training, research, development, innovation and entrepreneurship. The state will become a premier hub of EVs in a couple of years, he added.

208.title: Meta's Product Design VP Margaret Stewart to leave after 10 years
208.article_body: Meta's VP of Product Design Margaret Stewart will leave the company after over 10 years. Notably, Stewart also led Meta's now-dissolved Responsible Innovation team that focused on identifying potential harms of the firm's products. Announcing her departure, Stewart said she was "sad" that the team was reorganised but remains hopeful that its work will "continue to influence" what Meta builds.

209.title: US interest rates may go over 4.5% to tame inflation: JPMorgan CEO
209.article_body: America's largest bank JPMorgan Chase's CEO Jamie Dimon warned that US policymakers might have to increase interest rates to more than 4.5% to tame inflation amid a looming recession. Dimon said quantitative tightening and fragile energy supply could lead to an uncertain future. "It's bad...those things are huge turbulence...that can easily cause a recession," Dimon further said.

210.title: India's 5G is indigenous and can be provided to other nations: FM
210.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the 5G technology in India is completely indigenous except for some "critical parts" that have been imported. "There could be some critical parts coming from, say, countries like (South) Korea, but certainly not from somebody else. So complete indigenous technology that we can now provide 5G (to any country) who wants it," Sitharaman said.

211.title: Teen girl who worked in Bengaluru dies after getting molested in bus
211.article_body: A 19-year-old girl, who started her first job only two months ago in Bengaluru, died after getting molested in a moving bus while travelling to her hometown Belagavi, said police. She had bite marks on her lips and neck, along with cigarette burns and head injuries, an officer said. "She was assaulted, but she was not raped," said Belagavi ACP.

212.title: Asian govts spent $50 bn forex reserves in Sept amid rising dollar: Report
212.article_body: Asian governments spent about $50 billion in foreign exchange reserves in September, which is the highest since March 2020, amid surging US dollar, according to Exante Data Inc. Emerging Asian countries, excluding China, spent nearly $30 billion in dollar sales in the spot market in September, while the figure rose to $50 billion with the inclusion of Japan, Exante said.

213.title: Iftikhar plays like MS Dhoni but can't finish like Dhoni did: Ajmal
213.article_body: Former Pakistan spinner Saeed Ajmal said Pakistan batter Iftikhar Ahmad bats like MS Dhoni but cannot finish like Dhoni used to. "Dhoni used to take singles and hit sixes towards the end to compensate...Iftikhar plays 10 dot balls...and when...[he tries] to recover by hitting big shots...[he gets] out," added Ajmal. "Where do you stand?" he stated.

214.title: ED raids 25 locations in national capital in Delhi excise policy case
214.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Friday raided about 25 locations in the national capital as part of its money laundering case investigation in connection with the now-scrapped Delhi excise policy. The locations raided belong to private entities linked to liquor dealerships and distributorships, officials said. Earlier, ED raided about 35 locations in Delhi and Punjab in connection with the case.

215.title: Over 600 Russia-annexed settlements liberated in past month: Ukraine
215.article_body: Ukrainian soldiers have liberated more than 600 Russia-occupied settlements, including 75 in Kherson region, in the past month, Ukraine's Ministry for Reintegration of the Temporary Occupied Territories said. More than 500 settlements were liberated in Kharkiv, 43 in Donetsk and seven in Luhansk. Russia recently annexed four Ukrainian regions including Kherson, Donetsk, Luhansk and Zaporizhzhia.

216.title: Ammunition depot near border destroyed in Ukraine strikes: Russia
216.article_body: The governor of a Russian border region, Belgorod, has accused Ukraine of shelling an apartment building and blowing up an ammunition depot. No one was hurt in the attacks, Governor Vyacheslav Gladkov added. Meanwhile, Ukraine has denied Moscow's claim and said Russia had launched a missile toward Ukraine's Kharkiv city but "something went wrong and it hit [the] residential building".

217.title: Pune man arrested for vehicle thefts, 16 stolen two-wheelers seized
217.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 26-year-old man for allegedly committing vehicle thefts and recovered 16 stolen two-wheelers from him. About 200 CCTV cameras were checked and police got clues that led them to the accused, a press release stated. Police laid a trap and nabbed the man at the red light area in Budhwar Peth's Dane Ali.

218.title: Audience blasted with weed smoke from fog machine during rapper's performance in US
218.article_body: Audience at Kushstock Festival in US' California was recently blasted with weed smoke from fog machines during rapper Chucky Chuck's performance. A video shared by the rapper shows smoke coming out of the two cannabis cannons operated by a man on the stage while Chuck performs. The crowd can be heard cheering.

219.title: Development of K'taka took a back seat due to Cong's rule: Bommai
219.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai criticised Congress and said that the development of the state took a back seat due to Congress' 50 years of rule. "The Congress party has been doing Bharat Jodo Yatra...They cannot even implement pro-people policies but have indulged in power politics...The people will permanently send them back home in 2023," said Bommai.

220.title: TMC wants to remove Hindus from certain areas of Kolkata: Suvendu Adhikari
220.article_body: Talking about the Mominpur violence, BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari criticised the ruling TMC and alleged that the party wants to remove Hindus from certain areas of Kolkata. "This is CM Mamata Banerjee's vote bank politics. The Hindu vote is going towards the BJP and CM Banerjee is taking minority votes by threatening and doing communal campaigns," said Adhikari.

221.title: 2 on way to celebrate birthday killed in car accident in Mumbai, 7 injured
221.article_body: Two boys, aged 26 and 18, died in a car accident while they were on their way to celebrate someone's birthday. Seven others were also injured in the incident. One of the boys said that the car's tyre burst while they were on their way, following which, the driver lost control of the vehicle.

222.title: Beauty contest poster offers winner chance to marry NRI; Punjab police shares post
222.article_body: Posters of a beauty contest advertising that the winning girl will be given a chance to marry a Canadian NRI have been put up in Punjab's Bathinda. Sharing the poster, Bathinda Police tweeted, "Taking Swift action Bathinda Police registered FIR & action is being taken against the guilty persons. Violation of law will not be tolerated at any cost."

223.title: No jeans, T-shirts in class: Muzaffarnagar official warns teachers
223.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Muzaffarnagar administration has issued a circular warning teachers of all government schools and colleges against wearing jeans and T-shirts in classrooms as it may give a "wrong impression" to students. "It is a matter of discipline," said District Inspector of Schools (DIOS) Gajendra Kumar Singh. Female teachers need to wear saree or salwar-kameez, he added.

224.title: Snap employee data exposed after breach at a document firm: Report
224.article_body: Messaging app Snap has reported that its employees' data was exposed by a breach at a third-party document analysis firm, Elevate, Reuters reported. Elevate reportedly told Snap that an unauthorised party had accessed some of its computer systems in March 2022. According to a letter to a former employee, information including name, address and employment history may have been affected.

225.title: Uttarakhand BJP MLA apologises for 'patao goddesses' remark
225.article_body: Uttarakhand BJP MLA Bansidhar Bhagat on Thursday apologised for his 'patao goddesses' remark that he made on the International Day of the Girl Child earlier this week. "My intentions were pure. By saying 'patao', I just meant coaxing the goddesses for their blessings. Still, if my words have hurt anyone, I take them back," he said.

226.title: Spain newspaper uses snake charmer cartoon for India, Zerodha CEO calls it 'an insult'
226.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath has criticised a Spanish newspaper for using the caricature of a snake charmer to represent India. He shared a picture of La Vanguardia's front page on Twitter, which showed the caricature with the headline, "The Hour of the Indian Economy". Kamath said, "Quite cool that the world is taking notice, but the cultural caricaturing...is an insult."

227.title: Duo who cheated 600 to 700 people on pretext of jobs held in Noida
227.article_body: Two men who were operating from an office in Noida were arrested for allegedly cheating 600 to 700 people by forging fake passports, visas and tickets for them under the pretext of providing them jobs in the Gulf area. The accused's modus operandi was to set up a fake company and then collect ₹65,000 to ₹1 lakh from the applicants.

228.title: Tiger allegedly seen at Pune's Sinhagad Fort; forest dept on alert
228.article_body: A couple claimed on Thursday that they spotted a tiger at Pune's Sinhagad Fort. Deputy Conservator of Forests (Territorial) Pune Rahul Patil said that the forest department is verifying the claim. A police inspector said that a team was rushed to the spot after being informed about the claim and people in the vicinity were warned as a precautionary measure.

229.title: Probe started, will investigate all rumours: Police on Kerala human sacrifice
229.article_body: Kochi Deputy Commissioner of Police S Sasidharan has said that the investigation into the Kerala human sacrifice case has started and that all rumours will be probed. "It is progressing. We will decide on evidence collection soon. We haven't decided the date and time of evidence collection," he added. Police said that the accused allegedly lured victims with money.

230.title: 3-year-old boy found with grandmother's body in Ghaziabad's Modinagar
230.article_body: A three-year-old boy was found with his 58-year-old grandmother's body in Ghaziabad's Modinagar on Thursday, police said. Prima facie, she appeared to have suffered a head injury, police added. "When I reached my mother's house to pick up my son...I found her dead with injuries on the head...my son crying by the side of her body," the deceased's son said.

231.title: India reports 2,678 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 26,583
231.article_body: India reported 2,678 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,786 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 26,583. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,857 following 10 casualties in the last 24 hours.

232.title: Apple ordered to sell iPhones with charger by Brazil court, fined ₹156 crore
232.article_body: A Brazilian court on Thursday fined Apple 100 million reais (around ₹156 crore) and ruled that battery chargers must come with new iPhones sold in the country. The lawsuit filed by an association of borrowers, consumers and taxpayers argued that the company commits abusive practices by selling its flagship product without a charger. Apple said it will appeal the decision.

233.title: Bandhan Bank onboards Sourav Ganguly as brand ambassador
233.article_body: Bandhan Bank has announced Sourav Ganguly as its brand ambassador. Fondly called 'Dada' and 'Maharaja of Indian Cricket', Sourav Ganguly will be the voice of Bandhan Bank, helping the brand take its message to the masses. "This association is another step towards connecting strongly with consumers across the spectrum and reinforcing our ongoing mission of inclusive banking," the brand stated.

234.title: Set your house in order instead of lecturing: India after Pak raises Kashmir issue
234.article_body: After Pakistan accused India of committing atrocities in Jammu and Kashmir at the CICA summit in Astana, MoS for External Affairs Meenakashi Lekhi said, "Pakistan's remarks...constitute gross interference in India's internal affairs." She added, "With its own record of...dismal treatment of minority communities, Pakistan would be well advised to set its house in order instead of lecturing."

235.title: Turkey introduces jail terms for 'disinformation'
235.article_body: Turkish Parliament has passed a new media bill that could see reporters and social media users jailed for up to three years for spreading "disinformation". The Council of Europe said the new measure's vague definition of "disinformation" and the accompanying threat of jail could have a "chilling effect and increased self-censorship, not least in view of the upcoming elections in...2023".

236.title: 'I'll f*** you right here,' Pak minister's aide yells at man calling leader 'chor' in US
236.article_body: Pakistani minister Ishaq Dar was heckled by protestors at an airport in US' Washington DC, following which his aide was seen abusing a man calling Dar a 'chor' (thief). "I'll f*** you right here, motherf*****. You don't know me," the aide could be seen yelling at the protestor. Dar was in US to attend IMF and World Bank's meetings.

237.title: JPMorgan cuts ties with Kanye, gives him until Nov 21 to move assets
237.article_body: JPMorgan Chase has cut ties with Kanye West, officially known as Ye, and has given him until November 21 to transfer his business to another bank. A letter apparently sent by the bank to the rapper was shared by conservative activist Candace Owens. The bank reportedly sent the letter in September, weeks before Kanye received criticism over his anti-Semitic comments.

238.title: T'gana court acquits all 24 accused in connection with 2008 communal riots
238.article_body: A Telangana court has acquitted all the 24 accused in connection with the communal riots that broke out in Nirmal district's Bhainsa town in 2008. The prosecution had failed to furnish proper evidence to prove the charges, the court said. Notably, all the 24 accused were released on bail within three months of the incident.

239.title: Bengaluru Police seizes 1,580 kg red sandalwood, arrests 5
239.article_body: Bengaluru's Mahalakshmi Layout Police carried out raids at three places and seized 1,580 kilograms of red sandalwood, said police. Five suspects have been arrested and further investigation is underway, added police. Last month, Bengaluru Police had busted an inter-state gang and recovered 730 kilograms of sandalwood and 147 litres of sandalwood oil.

240.title: Work on Gurugram's Dhanwapur underpass to be completed soon: Dy CM
240.article_body: Haryana Deputy Chief Minister Dushyant Chautala confirmed that the Dhanwapur underpass project will be completed soon and that he will personally monitor the project's progress. The railway underpass is being developed in Gurugram's Sector 104, which will connect the old city with new sectors along the Dwarka Expressway. He further added that the expressway would be completed by next year.

241.title: One will rarely claim that Hardik can be T20 WC's top run-scorer: Nehra
241.article_body: Discussing the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India pacer Ashish Nehra said, "You will rarely see anyone claim that Dinesh Karthik or Hardik Pandya will finish as the tournament's leading run-getter because they'll face fewer deliveries." "Whoever bats at the top will...be among the runs," added Nehra. India will face Pakistan in their first match of T20 World Cup 2022.

242.title: 111 sentenced for drunk driving in Hyd, ₹2.36 lakh fine imposed
242.article_body: As many as 111 persons accused of drunk driving were produced before courts in Hyderabad on Wednesday. Five of them were sentenced to two days of imprisonment, while two were asked to do community service for two days. A collective fine of ₹2.36 lakh was imposed on the remaining 104 persons.

243.title: Pakistani drone allegedly carrying consignment shot down in Punjab
243.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Friday shot down a drone that entered India from Pakistan at the International Border in Punjab's Gurdaspur. It is suspected that the drone was carrying a consignment and a massive search operation has been launched in the area to determine the same. Gurdaspur BSF DIG said that the soldiers fired 17 rounds of bullets.

244.title: Watchman arrested for sexually assaulting 11-year-old in Mumbai
244.article_body: A 58-year-old watchman has been arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting an 11-year-old girl in south Mumbai. The incident took place when the minor girl was at her aunt’s place after the school. The accused allegedly sexually assaulted her behind a cab. A case has been filed in accordance with the Indian Penal Code (IPC) and POCSO Act.

245.title: Honda says it goes 'beyond' for its customers in its latest ad campaign
245.article_body: Aiming to celebrate its bond with its customers, Honda Cars India launched its new brand campaign 'A Honda Goes Beyond'. HCIL President and CEO, Takuya Tsumura, said credit goes to customers who bestowed their trust in Honda for the last 25 years and that it has been Honda's endeavour to keep customers at the centre of their products and services.

246.title: Kerala human sacrifice accused shared FB post on 'blacksmith's wife' after women's murder
246.article_body: Bhagaval Singh, one of the three persons accused of torturing and killing two women as 'human sacrifice' in Kerala, wrote a poem in his Facebook post days after the second woman's murder. "A furnace, blacksmith's wife at work, her body bent over," he wrote in Malayalam. Singh allegedly met Mohammed Shafi, the prime accused in the case, on Facebook.

247.title: Was told I did 'Soch', 'Joker' for sympathy; couldn't sing for 1.5 yrs: Harrdy
247.article_body: Singer Harrdy Sandhu said that he got messages saying that he does songs like 'Soch', 'Joker' and 'Naa Ji Naa' to gain sympathy. "I took it to my heart, I couldn't sing any song for 1.5 years. Then I picked myself up...and then I started singing and I started doing dance numbers...When they also worked...then I was happy," he added.

248.title: Even British didn't tax food: Kejriwal on Guj body's 18% GST on parantha order
248.article_body: After Gujarat Appellate Authority of Advance Ruling said that paranthas are different from rotis and that 18% GST is applicable on them, Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal took to Twitter to say that even the British did not tax food. "Today...the biggest reason for inflation in...the country is the high GST being levied by the central government," he wrote.

249.title: KTR has lunch at fluorosis victim's home in Telangana, shares pics
249.article_body: Telangana minister KT Rama Rao on Thursday visited the home of one of the victims of the fluorosis issue in Nalgonda and had lunch with him. Rao also shared pictures of the same, saying that he's happy the victim's family was provided a "dignity house and livelihood". "More importantly, fluorosis is gone now thanks to Mission Bhagiratha," he added.

250.title: Sensex jumps over 1,000 points, Nifty opens above 17,300
250.article_body: The benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Friday with the Sensex rising 1,068.31 points to 58,303.64. The Nifty was up 295 points to 17,309.30. Infosys, ICICI Bank, SBI, Larsen and Toubro and Bajaj Finance were among the major gainers on the Nifty. All sectors opened higher with Nifty Bank and Nifty IT indices leading the front.

251.title: Power Mech-RITES JV bags ₹499.41-cr order from Bengaluru Metro
251.article_body: Power Mech Projects Limited (PMPL) said it has bagged a ₹499.41-crore order from Bengaluru Metro Rail Corporation Limited for the construction of a depot cum workshop at Challaghatta in the Reach-2 Extension under phase 2 of the Bengaluru Metro. The project is awarded to RITES-PMPL, a joint venture of RITES Limited and Power Mech Projects, with 51:49 sharing.

252.title: Dutch Princess forced to move out of student home due to threats
252.article_body: Dutch Crown Princess Catharina-Amalia is under heightened security due to concern that she could be targeted by criminals. The 18-year-old began studying at the University of Amsterdam last month and had moved into an apartment in the city, but her parents revealed that concerns for her safety have forced her to move back to the royal palace in The Hague.

253.title: Person living in Punjab for some time expected to know Punjabi: HC
253.article_body: While hearing a plea by an NDPS convict, Punjab and Haryana High Court said that a person living and working in Punjab for some time is expected to be conversant with the Punjabi language. The plea claimed that the accused could not understand the non-consent memo and consent memo, written in Punjabi, as he is a native of Bihar.

254.title: Moscow to Delhi flight receives bomb threat call; passengers deplaned
254.article_body: Delhi Police have said that they had received a call about a bomb in an incoming flight from Moscow on Thursday night. "The flight landed in Delhi at around 3.20 am. All passengers and crew members were deboarded," the police added. They stated that flight was being checked and an investigation was underway.

255.title: Man suspected of kidnapping, murdering Indian-origin family in US pleads not guilty
255.article_body: The man suspected of kidnapping and murdering an Indian-origin Sikh family, including an eight-month-old baby, in US has pleaded not guilty. Jesus Salgado allegedly kidnapped the family at gunpoint from their trucking business. He has been charged with four counts of first-degree murder with special circumstances. If convicted, he could spend his life in prison without the possibility of parole.

256.title: Delivered cassettes to sex workers, underworld, police: Madhur on money issues
256.article_body: While talking about the financial crunch in his family, film director Madhur Bhandarkar said that for three years he delivered cassettes to people. "I delivered cassettes to all sorts of people - sex workers, girls from beer bars, the underworld, at skyscrapers and bungalows as well as jhuggi jhopris, to Bollywood people [and] to police," he added.

257.title: 2 women smuggling gold worth ₹74 lakh detained at Hyderabad airport
257.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit (AIU) of Hyderabad Customs detained two women at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport for trying to smuggle gold. The officials seized 1,410 grams of gold worth ₹74.02 lakh from their possession. The women, Nahith Sultana and Organs Begum, had arrived in Hyderabad from Dubai. A case has been registered.

258.title: Pune beneficiaries to get over 9,900 PM Awas Yojana flats by March 2023
258.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is set to hand over 9,900 flats under the Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) scheme by March 2023, officials said. PMC has completed almost 80% work of the flats and officials visited the PMAY's site located at Vadgaon on Thursday. The flats will be allotted on a first-come, first-serve basis.

259.title: 5, including a police officer, shot dead in US; young male suspect arrested
259.article_body: At least five people, including an off-duty police officer, were killed in an "active shooting" incident in the US state of North Carolina on Thursday. A police officer and one other person were shot and suffered non-life threatening injuries. A suspect behind the incident, described as a White juvenile male was taken into custody hours after the shooting, police said.

260.title: Our goals in Ukraine can be achieved through talks: Russia
260.article_body: Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said that the goals of Russia's "special military operation" in Ukraine remain unchanged, but they can be achieved through negotiations. "It takes two sides to have a dialogue. As the West is now taking a very, very hostile stance towards us, it's unlikely that there will be any such prospect in the near future," he added.

261.title: Kerala human sacrifice mastermind posed as woman named 'Sreedevi' on social media
261.article_body: Mohammad Shafi, the alleged mastermind in Kerala human sacrifice case, posed as a woman named 'Sreedevi' on social media and befriended another accused Bhagaval Singh, police said. Shafi reportedly used flowers as the display picture of the fake profile. Police have arrested three people for allegedly killing two women for financial gain.

262.title: Youth caught with electronic device during IBPS exam in Pune; held
262.article_body: A 25-year-old youth was arrested after being caught with an electronic device on his person during an Institute of Banking Personnel Selection (IBPS) exam in Pune. "The accused told us that with the help of...electronic gadget, he was taking the help of an outsider to solve the questions," police officials said. A case was filed against the accused and outsider.

263.title: 3 teenagers drown to death in 6-foot-deep ditch in Delhi
263.article_body: At least three teenagers drowned to death in a six-foot-deep ditch in Delhi's Pul Prahladpur, police said. The victims were playing in the area on Thursday afternoon when they accidentally slipped and fell into the ditch. The area usually has no water but due to rain in the last few days, rainwater had accumulated creating a six-foot-deep pond, police added.

264.title: 4.8 magnitude earthquake hits Chhattisgarh
264.article_body: An earthquake of magnitude 4.8 on the Richter Scale struck near Ambikapur in Chhattisgarh at 5:28 am on Friday. The National Center for Seismology said that the earthquake occurred 65 km west-northwest of Ambikapur, reports said. The epicentre of the earthquake was at Latitude 23.33 and Longitude 82.58. It had a depth of 10 km below the ground.

265.title: 28-year-old Indian student stabbed 11 times in suspected racial attack in Australia
265.article_body: A 28-year-old Indian student was attacked with a knife and allegedly stabbed 11 times by an unknown assailant in Australia on October 6. Shubham Garg, who is pursuing a PhD from the University of South Wales in Sydney, suffered multiple injuries and is said to be in a critical condition. His family is suspecting this to be a racial attack.

266.title: Pick-up truck rams into stationary truck in Gurugram; 2 killed
266.article_body: Two people were killed after the pick-up truck they were travelling in hit a stationary truck, which was parked after its tyre got punctured, near IFFCO Chowk in Gurugram on Thursday, police said. An inspector said that no precautionary steps were taken to alert other drivers that the truck was stationary. "We're trying to arrest [truck] driver," the SHO said.

267.title: Tattoo on 75-yr-old's arm helps rescuers reunite him with kin in Mumbai
267.article_body: A 75-year-old man found in a paralysed condition in Mumbai's Santacruz East area was reunited with his relatives after the rescuers located his location, the name of which was tattooed on his arm. Vijay Jagtap was found near a bridge on October 7 and had no recollection of how he had reached there, reports said.

268.title: I saw, I stole: Grocer on stealing Karva Chauth puja thalis in Delhi
268.article_body: A shop owner in Delhi was arrested for stealing over a dozen decorative 'thali' hampers used on Karva Chauth. The accused, who owns a grocery store, told police he was unable to resist the decorated plates and stole them when he saw them "unattended" at the Sadar Bazar wholesale market. Police arrested the accused within three hours.

269.title: Centre announces one-time aide for paddy straw pellet makers
269.article_body: Centre said it'll provide one-time financial support for setting up pellet manufacturing and torrefaction plants to enhance paddy straw utilisation in power plants and industries. Union Minister Bhupender Yadav released CPCB guidelines for this. A maximum grant of ₹14 lakh per ton/hour for a non-torrefied pellet plant and ₹28 lakh per ton/hour for a torrefied pellet plant is being provided.

270.title: Material coming out of black hole is like nothing we've ever seen: Scientists
270.article_body: As per a new study on a black hole that ripped a star in 2018, it's spewing out matter despite not swallowing anything in last few years. "No one has ever seen anything like this before," Yvette Cendes, the author of the study, said. It's spitting out material that's travelling at half the speed of light, the study added.

271.title: Hundreds of British citizens forced to cancel India trip due to visa delays
271.article_body: Several UK citizens looking to visit India have been forced to postpone or cancel their trips. This comes after visa agents in the country received notices that they could no longer apply for tourist visas on behalf of the applicant. It is aimed at preventing travel agents from illegally charging fees to get visas processed.

272.title: Rahul Gandhi climbs 80-foot-high water tank in K'taka to wave Tricolour
272.article_body: Congress MP Rahul Gandhi, Karnataka party chief DK Shivakumar, former CM Siddaramaiah and other party leaders climbed an 80-foot-high water tank in Karnataka to wave the Tricolour. The incident took place in Chitradurga district during Congress' Bharat Jodo Yatra. A video showed the leaders waving the flags as spectators cheered and chanted, "Bharat Jodo, Bharat Jodo."

273.title: WeWork India invests in Bengaluru-based conferencing platform Zoapi
273.article_body: WeWork India has invested in Bengaluru-based conferencing and collaboration platform Zoapi for an undisclosed sum. Zoapi was co-founded by Prashanth NS and Chaitanya Vasantarao in 2019 and is a unified conferencing and collaboration solution provider for co-working spaces. Zoapi is also a member of the Intel IoT Solution alliance. WeWork entered the Indian market in 2017.

274.title: Rohit doesn't feature in India's practice match despite being named in XI, fans react
274.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma didn't feature in India's practice match against Western Australia despite being named in playing XI. KL Rahul was named captain in the team sheet despite Rohit being included in the side. "Hope he is not injured," a fan tweeted. "Where is Rohit?" wrote another. India lost the practice match by 36 runs.

275.title: Only green firecrackers to be sold & burst in Chennai during Diwali: Police
275.article_body: Chennai Police on Thursday issued an advisory ahead of Diwali and noted that only "green" firecrackers, those made with chemicals deemed environment-friendly, would be allowed to be sold and burst. "No firecrackers making more than 125 decibel of sound should be manufactured, used or sold," police advisory stated. "Firing of rocket crackers near huts or multi-storey flats is...banned," it stated.

276.title: Gold, silver jewellery worth ₹3,000 cr sold on Karwa Chauth: CAIT
276.article_body: Indian traders' and retailers' bodies CAIT and AIJGF said that gold and silver jewellery reported around 36% of increases in sales on the occasion of Karwa Chauth on Thursday compared to last year. Gold and silver jewellery worth ₹3,000 crore was reportedly sold in India on Thursday. Price of 24-carat gold in Delhi was ₹52,000 per 10 grams, they added.

277.title: Tamil Nadu man arrested for demanding boycott of shops run by non-Hindus
277.article_body: A man in Tamil Nadu was arrested for demanding a boycott of shops run by non-Hindus. Sakthivel, the Karur district coordinator of Hindu Munnani, distributed pamphlets to shoppers appealing them to only shop from Hindu shop owners ahead of Diwali. A case was registered against him under Sections 153A and 505 of the Indian Penal Code (IPC).

278.title: SC questions need for pre-screening committee for web series, films
278.article_body: The Supreme Court questioned the need for a pre-screening committee for web series, films and other programmes released on OTT platforms. "For OTT satellite transmission is from other countries and not this one even though viewers may be here," a bench of CJI UU Lalit and Justice Bela M Trivedi said. The bench added that it felt pre-censorship is impermissible.

279.title: Reliance is sole bidder for Metro's India business: Report
279.article_body: According to Bloomberg, Reliance Industries is in advanced discussions to acquire Metro AG’s wholesale operations in India. A deal could be finalised as soon as next month. The report said Charoen Pokphand Group is no longer in talks with Metro, leaving RIL as the sole bidder. A deal could value the business at $1 billion to $1.2 billion including debt.

280.title: They put their fingers inside of us: Paris Hilton on sexual abuse at boarding school
280.article_body: Paris Hilton has said she was "sexually abused during medical examinations" at boarding school. She alleged that the Provo Canyon School in US' Utah would "perform cervical exams" routinely on the students. "This wasn't even with a doctor. It was with...staff members, where they would have us lay on the table and put their fingers inside of us," she stated.

281.title: Man shopping with his girlfriend on Karwa Chauth beaten by his wife in UP
281.article_body: A man was beaten by his wife in the market after she caught him shopping with his girlfriend in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad on Karwa Chauth. The man's wife was accompanied by other women. After the video of the incident went viral on social media, police took action against the man for causing a public nuisance.

282.title: MP govt to set up panel to aid SC,ST entrepreneurs: CM Shivraj Singh
282.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has announced a state-level committee will be established to provide facilities to entrepreneurs from SC and ST communities. He said a global skill park is being established in Bhopal jointly with Singapore. MSME and Dalit Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry signed an MoU for creating an ecosystem for the welfare of the community.

283.title: 'Criminals got no gender difference': Cong MLA booked for assaulting woman
283.article_body: Congress MLA Eldose P Kunnapillil, who was booked for assaulting his estranged girlfriend, through a Facebook post, denied having committed any crime on Wednesday. "I have not done anything illegal...Understand that criminals got no gender difference. Power is not the last word for me. God is the only help I believe in," he wrote.

284.title: Bezos' ex-wife MacKenzie donates $15 mn for glasses to farmers
284.article_body: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos' ex-wife and philanthropist MacKenzie Scott has donated $15 million to VisionSpring, a nonprofit that provides eyeglasses to farmers in developing nations. Scott, who received $38 billion in the divorce settlement, has donated more than $12 billion to over 1,275 organisations. Her philanthropic goals are to provide for causes often overlooked in the world of development.

285.title: Key accused in human sacrifice case to undergo psychological test: Kochi Police
285.article_body: Kochi Police Commissioner C Nagaraju on Thursday said that Mohammed Shafi, the prime accused in the Kerala human sacrifice case, will be subjected to a psychological examination. The test will be conducted by an expert doctor from a government hospital, he added. He claimed Shafi is a sexual pervert and a sadist with a mindset to cause injury and death.

286.title: Senior Cong officials to vote from home state or party HQ: CEA
286.article_body: The Congress Central Election Authority (CEA) Chairman Madhusudan Mistry said that in the party Presidential polls, the All India Congress Committee (AICC) officials can cast votes at booths in their home states or at the party headquarters in Delhi. Elections for the post will be held on October 17 and the result will be declared on October 19.

287.title: Disallowed in Delhi, same excise policy doing wonders in Punjab: Kejriwal
287.article_body: The excise policy 2021-22 that the AAP government was not allowed to implement in Delhi has worked wonders in Punjab, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Thursday. The AAP government in Delhi was forced to withdraw the policy in July after Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena asked the CBI to probe into the irregularities in the policy's implementation.

288.title: Tharoor made chair of parliamentary panel on chemicals & fertilizers
288.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor has been appointed as the chairperson of the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Chemicals and Fertilizers. Tharoor was earlier chairing the parliamentary panel on information technology and his name for the chemicals and fertilizers panel was suggested by Congress leadership. He is currently contesting the Congress Presidential polls against Mallikarjun Kharge.

289.title: Big B was to star in 'King Uncle' opposite me: 'Aashiqui' actress Anu
289.article_body: 'Aashiqui' actress Anu Aggarwal revealed that veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan was to feature in the 1993 film 'King Uncle'. "I was certainly looking forward to working with a legend like him, but, I believe whatever happens is a part of the universal scheme," she added. Amitabh's role was played by actor Jackie Shroff. The film also featured Shah Rukh Khan.

290.title: Excise collection in Punjab crosses ₹4,000 cr in 6 months for 1st time ever
290.article_body: Punjab Finance Minister HS Cheema on Thursday said for the first time ever, the state's excise collection crossed the ₹4,000-crore-mark within the first six months of current financial year. This year's collection so far is 37.62% higher than ₹3,110 crore collected between April 1-October 12, 2021, Cheema said. "This is end of liquor mafia and corruption in Punjab," he added.

291.title: 'Ponniyin...' beats 'Vikram', becomes highest grosser in Tamil Nadu
291.article_body: Mani Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan: I' has beaten Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' to become the highest-grossing film in Tamil Nadu, as per trade analyst Trinath. "At the end of Wednesday, Ponniyin Selvan: I's Tamil Nadu gross stood at around ₹186 crore. It has beaten Vikram's lifetime collection in [the state] in less than two weeks," the analyst stated.

292.title: Quranic commentaries misused: Owaisi on K'taka HC's hijab decision
292.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday claimed Karnataka High Court "misused" Quranic commentaries and translations when it passed a judgement validating hijab ban in educational institutions in the state in March. Its decision was bad in terms of law and content, Owaisi added. The court had said wearing of hijab by Muslim women isn't an essential religious practice in Islam.

293.title: Always wanted to be like Big B, he's still going on at 80: Ranveer
293.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh dedicated his Lokmat Maharashtrian of the Year 2022 award to veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan, who turned 80 on Tuesday. "I wanted to become Bachchan from my childhood, today also I want that...would want to become him in future. He's still going on at the age of 80, he's still acting," Ranveer said.

294.title: Ashok Gehlot is on path of rebellion from Congress: BJP's Malviya
294.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya claimed on Thursday that Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot is on the "path of rebellion" from the Congress. Malviya made the remark as he tweeted a clip where Gehlot was purportedly seen praising the work of Coal India and some decisions of Union Minister Pralhad Joshi. "This is in sharp contrast to Congress' belligerence," Malviya tweeted.

295.title: Jammu withdraws order on new voter registration following political row
295.article_body: Jammu administration has withdrawn the direction which authorised tehsildars or revenue officials to issue residence certificates to people living in the district for over a year to enable their registration as voters. The decision came shortly after the directive was issued. The order had led to strong opposition from non-BJP party leaders in the union territory including PDP's Mehbooba Mufti.

296.title: There's no space for students to stand: K'taka minister amid madrassa survey
296.article_body: Commenting on the ongoing survey of madrassas in Karnataka, state minister BC Nagesh said that some of the institutions don't have enough space for students to stand properly. Officials also reportedly claimed that students in some of the madrassas aren't being taught prescribed syllabus. This comes at a time when similar surveys are being conducted in other states including Uttarakhand.

297.title: 2-headed snake, valued at ₹25 crore, found in Bihar; pic surfaces
297.article_body: A two-headed snake, which is valued at around ₹25 crore, has been found in Bihar's Begusarai district. A court in the district has instructed the forest department officials to ensure the safe upkeep of the snake. Forest department officials said the snake was "not of a vicious temperament, known to prey upon only insects and rats".

298.title: Mukesh Ambani visits Kedarnath & Badrinath shrines; donates ₹5 cr
298.article_body: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani on Thursday visited the Kedarnath and Badrinath shrines in Uttarakhand. He donated ₹5 crore to the Badri-Kedar Temple Committee. In a video, Ambani was seen visiting the Badrinath shrine with his youngest son Anant Ambani's fiancée Radhika Merchant.

299.title: 24-year-old man gets life in prison for deadliest high school shooting in US
299.article_body: Jury has recommended Parkland shooter Nikolas Cruz, 24, should face life in prison in US' deadliest high school shooting. Jurors decided that while aggravating factors existed, they didn't outweigh mitigating circumstances of his mental health, therefore they couldn't recommend death penalty. Cruz killed 14 students and 3 staff members at Marjory Stoneman Douglas High School in February 2018.

300.title: Chhagan Bhujbal would have become CM had he not left Sena: Uddhav
300.article_body: Shiv Sena President Uddhav Thackeray on Thursday said senior NCP leader Chhagan Bhujbal would have become Maharashtra CM had he not quit Shiv Sena. "When Bhujbal left the Shiv Sena, I must admit that our family was in a state of shock," Uddhav said. "We could not digest it...that one of our own family members had deserted us," he added.

301.title: Carcass of male rhino found in Assam's Kaziranga National Park
301.article_body: A carcass of a male rhino was recovered near the entry gate to Kohora Range in Assam's Kaziranga National Park on Thursday, officials said. "The male rhino is suspected to have passed away due to...old age," an official said. Later, the forest officials collected the horn and stored it in the local treasury of the forest department, the official added.

302.title: Govt issues 'high severity' warning to Zoom users after vulnerabilities found
302.article_body: The government's CERT-In issued a 'high severity' warning saying that multiple vulnerabilities have been found in Zoom products which could allow attackers to prevent meeting participants from receiving audio and video. Affected software includes Zoom On-Premise Meeting Connector MMR before version 4.8.20220916.131 and Zoom Client for Meetings for macOS starting with 5.10.6 and prior to 5.12.0.

303.title: Navy engineer allegedly rapes his 19-year-old friend in Mumbai, probe underway
303.article_body: A Navy engineer has been booked for rape on the complaint of his 19-year-old friend in Mumbai, a police official said. "The teen victim was raped and the accused threatened her against revealing...ordeal to anyone claiming it'd only go on to malign her image," the official added. A case of rape under Section 376 has been registered against the accused.

304.title: Alex Jones ordered to pay $965 million to Sandy Hook families for lies about the massacre
304.article_body: Conspiracy theorist Alex Jones has been ordered to pay $965 million in damages to families of eight Sandy Hook school shooting victims and an FBI agent after falsely claiming for years that the 2012 massacre was a hoax. The families and the agent, who had responded to the attack, had sought at least $550m in the defamation trial in Connecticut.

305.title: Gutter mouth: Smriti Irani on AAP leader Gopal Italia after remark on PM Modi
305.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani has reacted to AAP leader Gopal Italia's purported derogatory remarks against PM Narendra Modi, calling the former a "gutter mouth". "I proffer no outrage, I don't want to show how indignant Gujaratis are but know this...[Aam Aadmi Party] shall be decimated electorally in Gujarat," Irani tweeted. Italia was earlier detained by Delhi Police and later released.

306.title: PhysicsWallah acquires edtech startups PrepOnline and Altis Vortex
306.article_body: Edtech unicorn PhysicsWallah has acquired PrepOnline, an online learning platform for NEET and Altis Vortex, an exam preparation books publisher, for an undisclosed sum. PhysicsWallah began as a YouTube channel by Prayagraj-based teacher Alakh Pandey in 2016. While Altis Vortex will be merging with PhysicsWallah's editorial team, 35 employees from PrepOnline will be joining the company.

307.title: BJP to observe 4th anniversary of Cong govt in Raj as 'Black Day'
307.article_body: The BJP will observe the fourth anniversary of the Ashok Gehlot-led Congress government in Rajasthan on December 17 as 'Black Day', PTI reported. The party will also hold demonstrations in the state's 200 Assembly constituencies and district headquarters from next month. The state unit of the BJP has also planned a state-level protest and 'jan aakrosh rally' in December.

308.title: 2 bikers ask auto drivers to share cigarette; hack them after they refuse
308.article_body: A couple of bike-borne youths, who were allegedly inebriated, hacked two auto rickshaw drivers, Ajmal and Shameer, in Kerala's Kollam after Shameer refused to share a cigarette with the accused. The accused began assaulting the victims before Shameer managed to escape. The accused then followed him and hacked him. Ajmal was also hacked when he tried to protect Shameer.

309.title: Piramal Pharma receives SEBI's nod to list shares on stock exchange
309.article_body: Piramal Pharma (PPL) said it has received approval from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to list shares on domestic stock exchanges, BSE and NSE. The company said it expects its shares to be listed next week. Piramal Pharma has been demerged from Piramal Enterprises Ltd (PEL) as a part of the simplification of the corporate structure.

310.title: SC refuses urgent hearing on plea against ban on crackers in Delhi
310.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday refused an urgent hearing on a plea against an order banning storage, sale and use of firecrackers in Delhi till January 1, 2023. The court asked the lawyer seeking an urgent hearing to approach the High Court. Supreme Court earlier refused to stay Delhi government's order banning storage, sale and use of firecrackers till January 1.

311.title: Mob of over 200 people attacks Gurugram mosque, assaults people offering namaz
311.article_body: A mob of over 200 people allegedly attacked a mosque in a Gurugram village on Wednesday night and assaulted people who were offering namaz inside. Earlier, the mob had reportedly threatened to expel them from the village and later locked the prayer hall. An FIR has been registered but no arrests have been made so far, police said.

312.title: Wonderful experience to work with Rani Mukerji in 'Aiyyaa': Prithviraj
312.article_body: Recalling his Bollywood debut film 'Aiyyaa', Malayalam actor Prithviraj Sukumaran has said, "It was a wonderful experience to share the screen with Rani Mukerji and work with director Sachin Kundalkar." The film had released in 2012. "I am inundated and grateful with the love and support that my fans from all across the nation are showering on me," he added.

313.title: Let us resume studies: Student on Hijab ban case referred to larger SC bench
313.article_body: Hiba Sheik, a 20-year-old student in Karnataka's Mangalore who was allegedly stopped from entering college to sit for exams in March, said students affected by hijab ban case "cannot afford to wait further". "We urge the Karnataka government to allow us to resume our studies," Sheik said. This comes after the case was referred to a larger bench on Thursday.

314.title: 83-yr-old Maha man swallows 5-cm-long denture; object removed without surgery
314.article_body: Doctors in Maharashtra have removed a single-tooth denture that had got stuck in the food pipe of an 83-year-old man after he accidentally swallowed it. Doctors said they manoeuvred the 5-cm-long and 3-cm-wide object into the stomach, from where they removed it without any surgery. A surgery couldn't be performed as the man had chronic kidney disease and other comorbidities.

315.title: Japanese yen hits its lowest level against the US dollar since 1990
315.article_body: The Japanese yen hit its lowest level against the US dollar since 1990 as one US dollar was worth 147.67 yen on Thursday. This comes as US inflation data indicated higher interest rate hikes from the Federal Reserve. Notably, US Consumer Price Index (CPI) increased 8.2% in the 12 months through September.

316.title: 'Stalker' Instagram page uploading videos of women without consent in Hyd, case filed
316.article_body: A case has been registered against an Instagram page by Hyderabad Cyber Crime Police for stalking and sharing photos and videos of women without their consent. The page 'jhamunda_2' shares videos that target a certain group of people, specifically young women and posts their videos with derogatory captions. It also allegedly encourages people to shoot such videos.

317.title: BJP shares video of AAP's Italia using derogatory language for PM's mother
317.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Thursday shared another video of AAP Gujarat chief Gopal Italia purportedly using derogatory language against PM Narendra Modi's 100-year-old mother. Calling Italia a "serial offender", Malviya said, "After constantly referring to women with the 'C' word...[Italia] now calls PM's aged mother 'nautanki baaz'." Italia treats women with sexist disregard, Malviya added.

318.title: 'Conflict tiger' that killed 13 people in Maharashtra captured, pic surfaces
318.article_body: A 'conflict tiger' that killed 13 persons in three districts in Maharashtra over the past 10 months was captured on Thursday by the forest department in Gadchiroli district of the state. The tiger named 'CT-1' has been sent to Gorewada rescue centre in Nagpur for rehabilitation. Officials had ordered the capture of the animal in a meeting on October 4.

319.title: Everything is okay between Chiranjeevi & me: Allu Arjun's father
319.article_body: Actor Allu Arjun's father and Telugu producer Allu Arvind has said that everything is "okay" between him and South star Chiranjeevi. This comes after there were speculations that actor Allu Arjun's family was not on good terms with Chiranjeevi and his son Ram Charan's family. "[Chiranjeevi & I] still visit each other's homes on Diwali and Sankranti," Arvind further stated.

320.title: What is a split verdict and what happens next in such cases?
320.article_body: The Supreme Court today delivered a split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case. A split verdict is passed when the Bench cannot decide one way or the other in a case. Split verdicts can only happen when the Bench has an even number of judges. In case of a split verdict, the case is heard by a larger Bench.

321.title: Photo of a ball of cactus bees wins wildlife photography competition
321.article_body: American photographer Karine Aigne has won the Grand Title in this year's Wildlife Photographer of the Year Competition organised by the Natural History Museum in London. Her photograph, titled 'The Big Buzz', shows a ball of cactus bees vying for a mate. All bees except one are males and they're intent on mating with the single female at the centre.

322.title: Video shows officials asking Dalits to serve branded tea to K'taka CM
322.article_body: The Karnataka Congress has shared a video that purportedly shows officials asking a Dalit family, where CM Basavaraj Bommai had breakfast, to serve only branded tea powder to him. In the video, an official is heard asking the family to get 250 grams of any company's tea. Bommai had breakfast with the Dalit family in Vijayanagara district on Wednesday.

323.title: My pen can never be silenced: Journalist Rana Ayyub on ED charges
323.article_body: "My pen can NEVER be silenced," tweeted journalist Rana Ayyub after the Enforcement Directorate (ED) filed a chargesheet against her under the Prevention of Money-Laundering Act (PMLA). Rejecting the ED's allegations, she said the COVID-19 relief funds raised by her was used solely for helping needy people. She claimed the chargesheet is an example of the abuse of PMLA law.

324.title: Priyanka Gandhi to address 'Parivartan Pratigya Rally' in Himachal on Friday
324.article_body: Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra will start the campaign in Himachal Pradesh for the upcoming state Assembly elections on Friday by addressing 'Parivartan Pratigya Rally' in Solan. Himachal Pradesh Congress Committee (HPCC) tweeted that this rally will officially mark the beginning of Congress' election campaign in the state. Her rally comes a day after PM Modi's visit to the state.

325.title: Foreign-brand cigarettes worth ₹17 cr seized from Guj's Mundra Port
325.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) has seized a container loaded with foreign-brand cigarettes worth ₹17 crore from Gujarat's Mundra Port. The officials conducted a raid and seized 850 containers, each containing about 10,000 cigarettes, from the port on October 11. The DRI has registered a case under the Customs Act and is questioning the importer.

326.title: Working with Salman Khan again in 'Tiger 3' is fantastic: Katrina Kaif
326.article_body: Speaking about working with actor Salman Khan in 'Tiger 3', actress Katrina Kaif has said that working with the actor again is fantastic. Katrina said she has much regard for the franchise as producer Aditya Chopra gives her character "that kind of prominence and importance in the action". The actress said that she loves doing action in a film.

327.title: Oct is 'biggest month' for crypto hacks as $718 mn crypto stolen: Report
327.article_body: Blockchain analysis firm Chainalysis has said, "October is now the biggest month in the biggest year ever for hacking activity." Cryptocurrency worth $718 million has reportedly been stolen from DeFi protocols so far in October, taking the gross tally for 2022 past $3 billion. "At this rate, 2022 will likely surpass 2021 as...biggest year for hacking on record," it added.

328.title: Nothing wrong in promoting Hindi, other Indian languages: BJP leader
328.article_body: BJP leader CT Ravi on Thursday said there is nothing wrong in promoting Hindi and regional languages instead of English. He refuted criticism from opposition leaders Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan and Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin that the Centre was imposing Hindi on non-Hindi speaking states. CT Ravi further urged people to come out of the "colonial mindset".

329.title: Very disappointed: Mamata on Asura resembling Mahatma Gandhi at Puja pandal
329.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said she was "very disappointed" over a Kolkata Durga Puja pandal's Asura idol which purportedly resembled Mahatma Gandhi. "What punishment should be given to [the creators]? Public will reply to such [a] shameful act. I...didn't say anything because there could've been protests during Puja," she said. The idol was reportedly later modified following outrage.

330.title: West Bengal govt hands over Letter of Intent to Adani Ports for Tajpur Port
330.article_body: The West Bengal government awarded the Letter of Intent (LoI) of Tajpur Port, located around 170 km southeast of Kolkata, to Adani Ports. An official statement from the government said the overall project will entail an investment of around ₹25,000 crore. The port is expected to create around one lakh direct and indirect jobs.

331.title: Kiara gets annoyed as photographers push senior citizens to click photos, video surfaces
331.article_body: A video shows actress Kiara Advani getting annoyed as media photographers accidentally pushed senior citizens in order to get her photos. Kiara had attended the screening of India's Oscar entry 'Chhello Show' in Mumbai. Amid the rush, Kiara can be heard telling photographers, "There are senior citizens and you are doing this. Careful. What are you guys doing?"

332.title: Michael Schumacher's 20-year-old nephew breaks his spine in fireball crash
332.article_body: Michael Schumacher's 20-year-old nephew David broke his spine after being involved in fireball crash during a DTM race in Germany. David was involved in the collision with Thomas Preining on lap six. It also resulted in another driver's car bursting into flames. David was initially given an all-clear but further scans confirmed a broken lumbar vertebra in his back.

333.title: Social service, training mandatory for violators of traffic rules: Kerala govt
333.article_body: Kerala government has mandated violators of traffic norms to undertake social service and training after nine people died in a road accident in the state. Drivers involved in critical accidents and drunk drivers will mandatorily be engaged in service of at least three days at trauma care centres. Drivers of contract carriages violating norms will mandatorily undergo service-cum-training programme.

334.title: 2 women police constables slap, scold girls for sitting in park in Punjab, video viral
334.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing two women police constables slapping and scolding college girls for sitting in a park in Batala in Punjab's Gurdaspur district. Both the constables have been transferred following the incident. The Batala Police stated that a departmental inquiry has also been initiated against them.

335.title: Son Ram Charan & I returned 80% fee: Chiranjeevi on Acharya's failure
335.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi has revealed that he and his son Ram Charan returned 80% of their remuneration to the makers of 'Acharya' after the film failed at the box office. "I take full responsibility when a film fails and I take the failure of 'Acharya' in my stride," he added. Chiranjeevi further stated that he had no guilt doing 'Acharya'.

336.title: Do I ask people to quit supporting me: Kharge on 'uneven playing field' remark
336.article_body: Congress presidential poll candidate Mallikarjun Kharge reacted to his rival candidate and fellow party leader Shashi Tharoor's "uneven playing field" remark, questioning if he should ask people to stop rendering support. "All delegates came together and decided I should contest...I am their candidate," Kharge further said. Tharoor had claimed that Kharge was receiving preferential treatment.

337.title: US retail inflation rises 8.2% in 12 months through September
337.article_body: US Consumer Price Index (CPI) increased 8.2% in the 12 months through September, after rising 8.3% in August 2022, data from the US Bureau of Labor Statistics showed. Meanwhile, CPI rose 0.4% in September and 0.1% in August. Increases in shelter, food and medical care indices were the largest contributors to the rise in inflation in the last month.

338.title: Singapore, UAE interested in accepting RuPay: Nirmala Sitharaman
338.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that Singapore and United Arab Emirates have expressed their interest in accepting RuPay payments. "We are talking to different countries. Singapore and UAE have all come forward now to make Rupay acceptable in their countries," Sitharaman said. She added that this feature would immensely help Indians travelling to these countries.

339.title: U'khand BJP leader seeks CBI probe as wife killed in clash between UP Police, villagers
339.article_body: Uttarakhand BJP leader Gurtaj Bhullar, whose wife was shot dead in a clash between villagers and UP policemen while chasing a criminal in Uttarakhand's Udham Singh Nagar, has sought a CBI probe into the incident. He has alleged that it was a bigger conspiracy. His wife was shot dead in a crossfire while she was returning home from work.

340.title: Khloé Kardashian has a 'rare' tumour removed from her face
340.article_body: American socialite Khloé Kardashian revealed that she had a tumour removed from her face. She said that she decided to get the bump on her face biopsied seven months after she realised it wasn't budging. The 38-year-old added that doctors told her that the bump on her face was "incredibly rare" for someone her age and advised an immediate operation.

341.title: Jaishankar to pay 2-day visit to Egypt to discuss bilateral issues
341.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar will pay a two-day visit to Egypt starting Saturday to discuss bilateral, regional and international issues of mutual interest with Egypt's Foreign Minister Sameh Hassan Shoukry. The Centre said the promotion of bilateral trade, commerce and investments will be one of the focus areas during the visit. Jaishankar will also interact with Egypt-based Indians.

342.title: AAP's Gopal Italia, detained over 'derogatory' comments on PM, released
342.article_body: AAP Gujarat chief Gopal Italia was released hours after he was detained by Delhi Police on Thursday over alleged derogatory remarks against PM Narendra Modi. In two videos that surfaced on social media, he was seen criticising PM Modi's politics and using a cuss word. Italia earlier claimed that the videos were doctored.

343.title: Can never please all: Shaheen on negative comments over Alia's pregnancy
343.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's sister Shaheen Bhatt has reacted to negative comments about the actress' pregnancy. "I will not speak for her because that is her own journey...Having said that, you can never really please everybody," she stated. Shaheen added they are all "very practised" at knowing what to focus on as they are living in the public eye.

344.title: HDFC Life gets final approval from IRDAI for Exide Life merger
344.article_body: HDFC Life Insurance Company said that it has received the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India's (IRDAI) final approval for its merger with Exide Life Insurance Company. HDFC Life had acquired a 100% stake in Exide Life from its parent Exide Industries after issuing over 8.7 crore shares at ₹685 per share and a cash payout of ₹726 crore.

345.title: UP govt announces new EV policy to attract ₹30,000 crore investment
345.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government announced a new electric vehicle policy to promote adoption of clean mobility solutions and create a conducive ecosystem for EVs. The government said the new electric vehicle policy aims to attract investment of over ₹30,000 crore and generate employment for over 10 lakh people. Government said the policy also enables provisions to attract big ticket investments.

346.title: Una-Delhi Vande Bharat train will benefit people of 3 states: Khattar
346.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Thursday said the Vande Bharat Express train, which has been started between Una and Delhi, will greatly benefit the people of Himachal Pradesh, Haryana and Punjab. Passengers will reach Chandigarh from Delhi in under three hours, Khattar said. The Vande Bharat Express train, the country's fourth, will run six days a week.

347.title: 17-yr-old Chennai student dies by suicide, teacher who 'broke up' with him arrested
347.article_body: A Tamil Nadu teacher has been arrested after a 17-year-old student that she was allegedly having an affair with died by suicide, police said. The police suspect that he died by suicide as the teacher ended the relationship with him after she got engaged. The teacher was arrested under POCSO Act and abetment to suicide of IPC.

348.title: There must be uniforms in schools, not hijab or other dresses: BJP MLA
348.article_body: BJP National General Secretary CT Ravi on Thursday stated that there should only be uniforms in schools, not hijab or other dresses. The Karnataka MLA added, "Uniform in schools is meant to promote uniformity among students." He claimed "separatist mindset" promotes the use of hijab or burqa in schools.
