He further said, "This mindset was the reason behind India's partition."

349.title: IKEA lays off 10,000 employees after halting Russia operations in March
349.article_body: Swedish ready-to-assemble furniture retailer IKEA said it had to cut 10,000 jobs in Russia after halting its operations in the country in March over the Russia-Ukraine war. IKEA shut down its stores in Russia and said it would sell factories. "The war in Ukraine is a human tragedy that is continuing to affect people and communities," IKEA had earlier said.

350.title: Levi's jeans from 1800s sells for over ₹62 lakh in a US auction; pics surface
350.article_body: A single pair of Levi's jeans from the 1800s was sold for $76,000 (more than ₹62 lakh) at an auction in the US. A 23-year-old vintage clothing dealer named Kyle Haupert, along with Zip Stevenson, bought the pair of jeans. The jeans were first discovered in an abandoned mineshaft in the American West and have suspender buttons on the waistband.

351.title: Was heartbreaking: 'Manike' singer on being in India during SL crisis
351.article_body: Sri Lankan singer Yohani, who sang the song 'Manike' in Ajay Devgn's 'Thank God', said that it was heartbreaking for her to deal with Sri Lankan economic crisis while she was in India. "My family...[is] there and I am in Mumbai, I'm not with them...But the only way through is to face it and keep going forward," Yohani stated.

352.title: Canara Bank writes off ₹1.29 lakh cr in bad loans; hides defaulters' names
352.article_body: Canara Bank has written off ₹1.29 lakh crore in bad loans in last 11 years but has refused to share names of defaulters, according to the bank's reply to an RTI filed by Pune-based activist Vivek Velankar. "Information sought is the personal information of borrowers," the bank's reply read. "Information sought isn't maintained in the manner sought for," it added.

353.title: 2 minor sisters, aged 5 & 3, killed in wall collapse in UP's Sitapur
353.article_body: Two minor sisters were killed when the wall of a kutcha house collapsed over them following heavy rains in Uttar Pradesh's Sitapur on Thursday, an official said. Five-year-old Shabia and three-year-old Mehak were playing near the wall that collapsed over them, Sitapur ADM RB Tiwari said. Action has been initiated to give financial assistance to the deceased's family, he added.

354.title: Never thought being good-looking would be negative in acting: Sidharth
354.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra said he never thought that being good-looking would be a negative for him in the profession of acting. "I thought we were here to face the camera and be easy on the eyes, but sometimes it tends to be negative," he added. Sidharth stated the audience likes to "see superficial things and not really connect to them".

355.title: Leaders openly supporting Kharge disturbs level playing field: Tharoor
355.article_body: Congress Presidential candidate Shashi Tharoor on Thursday claimed that leaders had openly come out to support Mallikarjun Kharge and even summoned meetings in his favour, saying it disturbed the level playing field. He further alleged that leaders were not available for a meeting with him, but they warmed up to Kharge when he visited them, asking for support.

356.title: BJP will retain power with two-thirds majority in Gujarat polls: Shah
356.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said the BJP will retain power with a two-thirds majority in the upcoming Gujarat Assembly elections. "It's because the people of Gujarat have put their trust in the BJP and the BJP has fulfilled...(their wishes) thoroughly," Shah said. He asked the people of Gujarat to be alert so the Opposition doesn't trick them.

357.title: Several parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts on October 15
357.article_body: Several places in Bengaluru will face power outages on October 15 (Friday) as Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) will carry out some maintenance and other work. A list of the affected areas has also been released. The affected areas include HSR Layout, Additional East Shivajinagar division, Davanagere, KR Layout, Marenahalli, Arya Nagar and Balaji Layout, among others.

358.title: Girls are wearing hijab because Allah has asked them to do so: Owaisi
358.article_body: After Supreme Court delivered split verdict in the Karnataka hijab ban case, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "I was expecting...unanimous judgement in favour of girls going to school in Karnataka wearing hijab." "Girls of Karnataka are wearing hijab because Allah has asked them to do so in Quran," he said. "BJP made it an issue out of it," Owaisi added.

359.title: Man, his 2-wheeler washed away in a flooded street in Hyderabad, video surfaces
359.article_body: Amid heavy rains in Hyderabad, a man and his two-wheeler were washed away in a street which had accumulated water with heavy currents. According to a video, the heavy currents caused the two-wheeler and the man, who was rescued by locals, to be taken in its tide. The IMD had issued a yellow alert for Hyderabad for three days.

360.title: Sudanese national illegally staying in Hyderabad deported
360.article_body: A Sudanese national was deported back to his home country after it was found that he was illegally staying in Hyderabad. Mohamed Mahmoud Elawad Fadalla was taken into custody by the Hyderabad Narcotics Enforcement Wing. He had come to India in 2015 on a student visa which expired in 2018, after which he continued to stay.

361.title: 39-yr-old assaults doctor in Thane, creates ruckus in hospital; held
361.article_body: A man was arrested in Maharashtra's Thane district for allegedly assaulting a doctor and creating ruckus at a hospital, a police official said on Thursday. The accused entered the hospital in an inebriated condition and fought with a senior citizen who was getting treated for a dog bite, the official said, adding that he assaulted the doctor when he intervened.

362.title: Prime accused in Mohali RPG attack arrested in Mumbai
362.article_body: The prime accused in the rocket-propelled grenade (RPG) attack on Punjab Police's intelligence headquarters in Mohali was arrested in Mumbai on Thursday. Charat Singh had allegedly provided ammunition to those who hurled RPG at the headquarters in May 2022. Charat, an aide of Canada-based gangster Lakhbir Singh, was on parole in a murder case when he committed the crime.

363.title: Stalker kills 20-year-old woman by pushing her in front of moving train in Chennai
363.article_body: A 20-year-old college student was killed after being deliberately pushed by her stalker in front of a moving train at St Thomas Mount Railway Station in Chennai. As per preliminary reports, the duo had a heated argument on the platform before the man committed the crime. The police have formed two special teams to nab the accused, who is absconding.

364.title: Prototype turbine sets world record of generating most power in 24 hrs
364.article_body: Siemens Gamesa's prototype wind turbine generated 359 megawatt-hours of power in one day, setting the world record for the most amount of power generated in a 24-hour period. Power generated by the prototype would be enough to power 18,000 households. The breakthrough was achieved using a set of "revolutionary" blades that are cast in a single piece of recyclable resin.

365.title: 4-week-old lost leopard cub reunited with mother at Mumbai park
365.article_body: A lost leopard cub was reunited with its mother at Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP) by officials of the forest department on Wednesday. A video showed the mother nursing the four-week-old cub before the two disappeared in the bushes. The cub was found by security staff on Monday at Film City, 100 metres from the boundary wall of SGNP.

366.title: I will go on to do bigger things: Sourav Ganguly on exit from BCCI
366.article_body: Sourav Ganguly, who'll reportedly hold no post in BCCI following his end of tenure as BCCI President, said, "I've been an administrator and I'll move on to something else." He added, "I will go on to do bigger things. You can't be a player forever, you can't be an administrator forever. It's been great doing both."

367.title: 6,436 madrasas found unrecognised, survey to continue: UP minister
367.article_body: UP Minority Welfare Minister Dharampal Singh on Wednesday said that 6,436 unrecognised madrasas have been identified in the state so far. He said the survey of UP's unrecognized madrasas will continue as its time period has been extended till October 20. He added that the survey is being conducted in view of better education for the children of minority communities.

368.title: Coal India signs MoU to set up 1,190 MW solar power plant in Rajasthan
368.article_body: Coal India Ltd (CIL) signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with the Rajasthan Vidyut Utpadan Nigam Ltd (RVUNL) to install a 1,190-MW solar power plant in Bikaner district of Rajasthan. The solar plant will be set up in a 2,000-MW solar park in Poogal, Bikaner. The state government has allotted 4,846 hectare land to develop the park.

369.title: We do not support dual employment: Infosys on moonlighting
369.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh spoke on the moonlighting debate in the IT industry and said, "To be clear, we don't support dual employment." He said that the company supports employees working on certain external gig projects after the prior approval of managers. He also revealed Infosys let go of some employees after they were found working in two different companies.

370.title: Huge outrage in Patel community: Kejriwal on Gopal Italia's arrest
370.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday criticised the detention of party's Gujarat unit president Gopal Italia over his alleged objectionable remarks against PM Narendra Modi. Tweeting over his detention, Kejriwal said, "With the arrest of Gopal Italia, there's huge anger among the Patel community in Gujarat." "Why the entire BJP after Italia?" he said in another post.

371.title: 58-yr-old watchman rapes 11-yr-old girl waiting for teacher in Mumbai
371.article_body: Mumbai Police on Wednesday arrested a 58-year-old watchman for allegedly raping an 11-year-old girl. According to Mumbai Police, the girl had gone to tuition but decided to wait for her teacher who hadn't reached. Upon seeing the girl alone, the accused took her to a secluded spot and committed the crime. She informed her teacher later, police said.

372.title: Italia is Sardar Patel's descendant, isn’t afraid of jail: AAP MP
372.article_body: After AAP's Gujarat chief Gopal Italia was detained by the Delhi Police from the office of NCW on Thursday, AAP MP Raghav Chadha said, "Gopal Italia is a descendant of Sardar Patel. He isn't afraid of your jail." Italia had been summoned by NCW chief Rekha Sharma over a video allegedly showing him using derogatory language against PM Narendra Modi.

373.title: Singapore Airlines holds talks with Tata over integration of Vistara, Air India
373.article_body: Singapore Airlines (SIA) said that it has held confidential discussions with the Tata Group over a potential integration deal involving Vistara and Air India. "The discussions seek to deepen the existing partnership between SIA and Tata," Singapore Airlines said in a statement. However, it added the discussions were ongoing and no definitive terms were agreed upon yet.

374.title: Infosys' attrition drops to 27.1%, net employee addition at 10,032 in Jul-Sept
374.article_body: Infosys on Thursday reported a 1.3% QoQ drop in its voluntary attrition rate from 28.4% in April-June quarter to 27.1% in July-September quarter. The IT firm added that its net employee addition in the quarter was 10,032 individuals, down 52.6% QoQ from net employee addition of 21,171 people in April-June quarter. Infosys' share of female employees remained stable at 39.3%.

375.title: Cyberabad Police launch 10 more Traffic Task Force teams to regulate traffic
375.article_body: Cyberabad Police launched 10 more 'Traffic Task Force' teams on Wednesday to help regulate traffic movement on busy roads. Cyberabad Police Commissioner, Stephen Raveendra, flagged off the teams comprising two policemen each at IT corridor, Gachibowli. The police teams are provided with motorcycles and they will be able to swiftly act wherever there are traffic jams or slowdowns, Raveendra said.

376.title: Infosys announces share buyback proposal of ₹9,300 crore
376.article_body: Infosys' board of directors approved the buyback proposal aggregating to ₹9,300 crore in order to reward its shareholders. The company will buy back 5 crore shares via the open market route at a price of ₹1,850 per share. The approval was granted alongside the company's Q2 results, where Infosys reported an 11% YoY increase in consolidated net profit.

377.title: 3 accused in Kerala human sacrifice case sent to 12-day police custody
377.article_body: A magistrate court in Kerala's Ernakulam has sent the three accused persons in the alleged human sacrifice case in Kerala to police custody for 12 days. The accused had killed two women, allegedly as part of a human sacrifice for financial gain. One of the accused reportedly confessed that they consumed a portion of the victims' body parts after cooking.

378.title: Meta to let users add legs to their metaverse avatars
378.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has announced that users will now be able to add legs to their metaverse avatars. "I know you've been waiting for this...But...legs are hard, which is why other virtual reality systems don't have them either," Zuckerberg's avatar said during a presentation. Meta also announced that it's bringing avatars to video call, starting with WhatsApp and Messenger.

379.title: Vedantu buys majority stake in test prep platform Deeksha for $40 mn
379.article_body: Tiger Global-backed edtech startup Vedantu said it has acquired a majority stake in offline test preparation platform Deeksha for $40 million. Karnataka-based Deeksha was founded by Sridhar G in 1998 and has centres in Karnataka, Telangana, and Andhra Pradesh. The investment in Deeksha will bring about 13,000 students to Bengaluru-based Vedantu's platform, the latter said.

380.title: Zaporizhzhia does not need Russian fuel: Ukraine nuclear company chief
380.article_body: Ukraine's nuclear energy company Energoatom's chief Petro Kotin has denounced Russia's comments that Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant will need Russian fuel, Reuters reported. "There are a lot of rumours...from Russians...it's not easy to just transfer the fuel loading in Zaporizhzhia from one supplier to another," Kotin said. Fresh fuel supplies are in storage at the plant, he added.

381.title: Veranda Learning acquires CA coaching centre JK Shah Classes for ₹337.82 crore
381.article_body: Edtech firm Veranda Learning Solutions on Thursday announced it has signed a definitive agreement for the acquisition of 39-year-old CA coaching centre JK Shah Classes for ₹337.82 crore. The 39-year coaching centre's alumni include billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla and Union Minister Piyush Goyal, professor JK Shah said. After the acquisition, Shah will remain Chairman for life on the board.

382.title: Army's assault dog Zoom, who fought terrorists despite being shot twice, martyred
382.article_body: Army assault dog Zoom, who was shot twice while fighting terrorists in J&K's Anantnag, succumbed to his injuries on Thursday while undergoing treatment. Zoom passed away at around 12 pm at the Advance Field Veterinary Hospital. The Army had sent Zoom inside the house where the terrorists were holed up during a cordon and search operation.

383.title: Man called me 'B' word, sister Akshara hit him from behind: Shruti Haasan
383.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan revealed her sister Akshara Haasan has beaten up people for her. Recalling an incident, she said, "Somebody called me the 'B' word once, and next thing I hear is this man screaming...Akshara hitting him from behind and saying, 'How dare you call my sister that?'" "I was more like a verbal assault...she is more violent," Shruti added.

384.title: That's the whole point: Dwayne on possible Black Adam vs Superman film
384.article_body: Hollywood actor Dwayne Johnson has spoken about the possibility of a film where his character Black Adam fights Superman on screen. When asked about a Black Adam and Superman crossover film, Dwayne replied, "Absolutely. That is the whole point of this [Black Adam's stand alone film], man." 'Black Adam' is a spin-off of 2019 film 'Shazam!', featuring Zachary Levi.

385.title: Nehru's 'insertion' of Article 370 caused Kashmir issue, PM resolved it: Shah
385.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said due to former PM Jawaharlal Nehru's "mistake" of "inserting Article 370, Kashmir was in a mess". Furthermore, he added, "It couldn't be properly integrated with the country. Everybody wanted the removal of Article 370. Prime Minister Narendra Modi removed it in one stroke and completed the integration of Kashmir with the country."

386.title: IIT graduate's AI investment advisory firm raises $1 mn in funding
386.article_body: Artificial intelligence (AI) investment advisory firm Wright Research has raised $1 million in seed funding from Orios Venture Partners. Founded in 2019 by IIT Kanpur graduate Sonam Srivastava, the wealth-tech startup previously raised a pre-seed round with BSE Institute Startup Incubator through Nidhi Seed Support System. Wright Research claims it has almost ₹200 crore in assets under advisory.

387.title: Mumbai to get over 5,800 new CCTVs by the end of December
387.article_body: Mumbai is expected to get 5,837 new CCTV cameras by the end of December as part of the second phase of the surveillance network, home department officials said. The new CCTVs will come up at more than 2,300 locations at the cost of ₹323 crore. Apart from helping curb crime, the cameras are used for traffic management and disaster management.

388.title: Sajid asked me to raise my top and show stomach for giving me role: Actress Kanishka Soni
388.article_body: Actress Kanishka Soni claimed that filmmaker Sajid Khan, who's currently a contestant in 'Bigg Boss 16', called her to his home and asked her to raise her top to show stomach for giving her a role in his movie in 2008. "I feel so insecure while telling you all the whole truth...These powerful personalities can kill me anytime," she added.

389.title: At least cross check: 'Taarak...' director on news reports saying Disha has cancer
389.article_body: Denying reports, which claimed that Disha Vakani is suffering from throat cancer, 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' director Malav Rajda said people should "at least cross check" such news. Stating that the reports are "completely false", Rajda added that such reports "can affect so many people". Disha is known for playing Dayaben in 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah'.

390.title: Mumbai's Metro Line 2A, 7 clear designs and standards testing
390.article_body: The Mumbai Metro Line 2A (Dahisar to DN Nagar) and Line 7 (Dahisar East to Andheri East) have cleared RDSO (Research Designs and Standards Organisation) testing and will now undergo testing for signalling, an MMRDA official said. "The RDSO test is an important milestone that has been achieved. In the next few days, certification will be issued," the official added.

391.title: 74-year-old man beaten to death with sticks in Varanasi, 5 arrested
391.article_body: A 74-year-old man died after allegedly being beaten with sticks by a group of men near his house in UP's Varanasi on Wednesday night, police said. Five of the 17 accused were arrested while nine police personnel have been suspended. The victim and his son were purportedly attacked when they objected to a group of men fighting near their house.

392.title: 15-year-old girl found hanging from tree in Jharkhand's Dumka
392.article_body: A 15-year-old tribal girl, who studied in Class 10, was found hanging in Jharkhand's Dumka district on Wednesday, said police. The victim's father said that a 22-year-old man, with whom her daughter was having an affair, killed her and hanged her body to make it look like suicide. He said the man told him where he could find his daughter.

393.title: Passenger vehicle wholesales rise by 92% in September
393.article_body: Passenger vehicle wholesales in India surged by 92% to 3,07,389 units in September as compared to 1,60,212 units in the corresponding month last year, the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers said on Thursday. Two-wheeler sales also increased by 13% to 17,35,199 units as against 15,37,604 vehicles in September 2021. Total commercial vehicle sales rose by 39% to 2,31,880 units.

394.title: Iran's Chief Justice orders harsh sentences for 'main elements of riots': Report
394.article_body: Chief Justice of Iran Gholam Hossein Mohseni Ejei has ordered judges to issue tough sentences for the "main elements of riots" sparked after death of Mahsa Amini, a report said. Judges have been reportedly instructed to "avoid showing unnecessary sympathy". Protests broke out after 22-year-old Amini died after being arrested by Iran's morality police for not following Islamic dress code.

395.title: Unable to recover loan from defaulters, bank manager kills self in Puducherry
395.article_body: A bank manager working at UCO Bank in Puducherry hanged himself after being unable to recover the loans from defaulters. The manager reportedly issued loans to many people in order to reach the targets. On being unable to recover loans and bear pressure from higher authorities, he himself took a loan and later committed suicide due to financial pressure.

396.title: Gold, foreign currency worth ₹8 cr seized at Mumbai airport; 7 held
396.article_body: Mumbai airport's Customs department seized 15 kilograms of gold worth ₹7.87 crore in four different cases and also seized foreign currency worth ₹22 lakh in two different cases. As many as seven people were arrested, reports said. In one of the cases, an Indian national was held with gold over ₹5.20 crore, which was hidden in a chest belt.

397.title: British artist live-streams burning 1,000 of his paintings after selling them as NFTs
397.article_body: British artist Damien Hirst burnt 1,000 paintings that were a part of his collection called 'The Currency' after he sold them in digital form as non-fungible tokens (NFTs). After launching the collection in 2021, Hirst gave a choice to buyers to either keep the NFT or acquire a piece of the physical work. He also live-streamed himself burning the paintings.

398.title: Indian startup funding at 2-year low in Q3: Report
398.article_body: Amid global funding winter, Indian startup funding hit a two-year low at $2.7 billion in the third quarter of the year across 205 deals, according to a report by PwC India. The report stated that the decline was the least at the early stage of funding. The funding activity declined to $2.7 billion from $6.6 billion in the previous quarter.

399.title: Man arrested from T'gana for killing IB officer during 2020 Delhi riots
399.article_body: A 34-year-old man, one of the accused in Intelligence Bureau (IB) officer Ankit Sharma's murder during the 2020 Delhi riots, has been arrested from Telangana's Meerpet, officials said. The accused was arrested from a chemist shop that he used to visit, police added. Sharma was stabbed 52 times by sharp-edged weapons, as per the autopsy report.

400.title: Hijab matter will continue to attract SC's attention: Congress
400.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday said, "Supreme Court's split verdict in the hijab case means that the matter will continue to attract the court's attention." Notably, Justice Hemant Gupta upheld the hijab ban in educational institutions in Karnataka, while Justice Sudhanshu Dhulia said, "Wearing hijab is a matter of choice". The court has referred the matter to the CJI.

401.title: I don't even know him: Babar on viral video of Pak TV host criticising him
401.article_body: On being asked about his criticism in reference to a viral video in which Pakistan TV host Aftab Iqbal is seen criticising him, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said, "I don't know who you're talking about. I don't even know him." In the viral clip, Iqbal says, "Babar is no more a star for me...because of his ego issues with players."
